It provides the capability to search for videos, retrieve standard feeds, and see related content. A program can also authenticate as a user to upload videos, modify user playlists, and more.
This integration can be used for a variety of uses such as developing a web application allowing users to upload video to YouTube, or a device or desktop application that brings the YouTube experience to a new platform. The Data API gives users programmatic access to the video and user information stored on YouTube. This can be used to personalize a web site or application with the user's existing information as well as perform actions like commenting on and rating videos. This RESTful API provides responses in XML format.

title: Mashup: I Drank This
description: A social media-driven platform for recording and sharing your wine, beer, and cocktail tasting experiences. By tweeting with the hashtag #idrankthis and optionally attaching a photo, your drink preferences and personal notes are automatically logged and shared, facilitating social interaction and record-keeping.

related_apis.title: Amazon Mechanical Turk API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: From their site: Amazon Mechanical Turk provides a web services API for computers to integrate Artificial Artificial Intelligence directly into their processing by making requests of humans. Developers use the Amazon Mechanical Turk web services API to submit tasks to the Amazon Mechanical Turk web site, approve completed tasks, and incorporate the answers into their software applications. To the application, the transaction looks very much like any remote procedure call - the application sends the request, and the service returns the results. In reality, a network of humans fuels this Artificial Artificial Intelligence by coming to the web site, searching for and completing tasks, and receiving payment for their work.

related_apis.title: Twitter API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: [This API is no longer available. It has been split into multiple APIs, including the Twitter Ads API, Twitter Search Tweets API, and Twitter Direct Message API.This profile is maintained for historical, research, and reference purposes only.]The Twitter micro-blogging service includes two RESTful APIs. The Search API methods give developers methods to interact with Twitter Search and trends data. The API presently supports the following data formats: XML, JSON, and the RSS and Atom syndication formats, with some methods only accepting a subset of these formats.

related_apis.title: TwitPic API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The TwitPic API lets you upload and post images to your Twitter account. You can upload an image for later posting or upload an image to TwitPic and automatically send it as a status update to Twitter.

related_apis.title: Twitgoo API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Twitgoo is a quick, reliable, and safe way to share images for Twitter. The Twitgoo API allows you to create an interface to talk to the Twitgoo service and create applications that can use Twitgoo to share media on Twitter.

related_apis.title: ImageShack API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: ImageShack offers image hosting, free photo sharing and video sharing. The ImageShack platform allows integration of ImageShack's services into any website or software via the use of its XML API.

related_apis.title: Heroku API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Heroku API is used for manually manipulating Heroku apps. Heroku is a cloud application platform for Ruby giving developers a new way of building and deploying web apps. The service lets app developers spend 100% of their time on their application code, not managing servers, deployment, ongoing operations, or scaling.
The RESTful API lets users manage and deploy Rails apps to the Heroku platform. Responses are formatted in XML.

title: Mashup: BlogUSphere Moods
description: BlogUSphere Moods is an advanced mapping application that visualizes the emotional state of US bloggers in real-time. By integrating the We Feel Fine API, Yahoo Pipes, and Google Maps, the mashup collects and displays the sentiments expressed in US blogs, allowing users to see which regions are predominantly happy or sad. This interactive tool provides a unique insight into the collective mood of US bloggers and showcases the power of social data visualization.

related_apis.title: Google Maps API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: [This API is no longer available. Google Maps' services have been split into multiple APIs, including the Static Maps API, Street View Image API, Directions APIs, Distance Matrix API, Elevation API, Geocoding API, Geolocation API, Places API, Roads API, and Time Zone API.This page is maintained purely for historical and research purposes.]The Google Maps API allow for the embedding of Google Maps onto web pages of outside developers, using a simple JavaScript interface or a Flash interface. It is designed to work on both mobile devices as well as traditional desktop browser applications. The API includes language localization for over 50 languages, region localization and geocoding, and has mechanisms for enterprise developers who want to utilize the Google Maps API within an intranet. The API HTTP services can be accessed over a secure (HTTPS) connection by Google Maps API Premier customers.

related_apis.title: We Feel Fine API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: From their site: Since August 2005, We Feel Fine has been harvesting human feelings from a large number of weblogs. Every few minutes, the system searches the world's newly posted blog entries for occurrences of the phrases "I feel" and "I am feeling". When it finds such a phrase, it records the full sentence, up to the period, and identifies the "feeling" expressed in that sentence (e.g. sad, happy, depressed, etc.). The result is a database of several million human feelings, increasing by 15,000 - 20,000 new feelings per day.

title: Mashup: Price Crisis
description: An interactive game that leverages the Zappos API for real-time product data and the Twilio API for seamless communication, allowing players to participate in a dynamic price competition. The mashup combines online shopping with a gaming experience, where participants can compare prices in real-time and engage in price-related challenges using their mobile devices.

related_apis.title: Twilio API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Twilio provides a simple hosted API and markup language for businesses to quickly build scalable, reliable and advanced voice and SMS communications applications. Twilio provides a telephony infrastructure web service "in the cloud", enabling web programmers to integrate real-time phone calls into their applications. Twilio's simple Pay-As-You-Go pricing model means customers pay for capacity only when they need it, not before. Voice applications written on Twilio's cloud solution scale transparently, eliminating programming, operational and contractual headaches frequently associated with rapid growth or traffic spikes.

related_apis.title: Zappos API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
We're happy to announce that we've launched our public API! Find out full details at http://developer.zappos.com.
A few of the things you can accomplish with our API:
Search : Leverage Zappos robust product search functionality that includes sorting, filtering, and a deep level of categorization/facets
Products : Pull relevant product details (description, default images, different styles, price)
Images : The full set of images for products (different views, sizes, etc.)
Statistics: Find out what is being bought right now!
Brands: Did you know we carry almost 1000 brands? Get more details on specific brands with this API
Reviews: Zappos has thousands of reviews from our amazing customers. Find out what our customer's are saying about our products
The API will be a REST API. In this initial release, it will only return JSON but upcoming releases will support XML.

title: Mashup: Altmetric Explorer
description: A data visualization tool that aggregates mentions of scholarly articles from multiple sources, including social media, blogs, and news outlets, and provides a web interface to view analytics. It also offers badges that can be embedded into websites to showcase the impact of published work. Altmetric is designed for publishers, institutions, and researchers who want to track the reach and engagement of their scholarly articles. It uses the Mendeley API as a source for scholarly articles and caters to the field of science and academia.

related_apis.title: Altmetric API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Altmetric is a powerful web application that tracks online conversations about scientific articles. It searches for mentions of scholarly works on social media sites, scholarly bookmarking services, and in science news outlets. Altmetric collects and analyzes hundreds of thousands of postings about tens of thousands of articles and datasets each month.
This data is made available to end users through a web interface and to developers through an API. The Altmetric API functions using REST calls issued in JSON and JSONP.

related_apis.title: Mendeley API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Mendeley is a platform that allows scholars from all over the world to collaborate, and opens up science for everyone. The Mendeley API enables users to programmatically access reference materials and user information from the platform. API methods are available to manage catalogs, datasets, documents, files, groups, institutions, locations, annotations, academnic status and more. If you’re inspired to contribute to our mission to build tools to make researchers’ lives easier, we’d love you to join our API community.

title: Mashup: Pryv Moves Bridge Server
description: A middleware service that facilitates the integration between Moves, an activity tracking app, and Pryv, an eHealth middleware for managing longitudinal health data. This service acts as a bridge, enabling data transmission and storage from Moves to Pryv, thereby enhancing Pryv's capabilities in handling real-time health data from various sources. It supports a RESTful API for seamless data exchange and integration, allowing for medical-grade data transmission and storage in a longitudinal data context.

related_apis.title: Pryv API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Pryv is a platform for collecting personal, time-based data of all kinds to give users a visual overview of their online lives. This data may include health metrics, locations, videos, notes, or anything else with a time attached to it. Pryv unites all of these heterogeneous data streams and sources to allow users to view the data-based aspects of their lives as a complete picture. This data may be kept entirely private or shared with select individuals. The Pryv API allows users to retrieve their personal data from Pryv via REST calls.

title: Mashup: 44tips - your visual start page
description: A personalized dashboard platform that aggregates and visualizes user-selected multimedia content into a single interface. Users can import their photos, videos, music, and bookmarks, and view them alongside their favorite websites. The mashup includes features for discovering similar content, saving it for later, and sharing it with others. It integrates various content types and sources to create a unified and customizable experience.

related_apis.title: Flickr API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Flickr API can be used to retrieve photos from the Flickr photo sharing service using a variety of feeds - public photos and videos, favorites, friends, group pools, discussions, and more. The API can also be used to upload photos and video.The Flickr API supports many protocols including REST, SOAP, XML-RPC. Responses can be formatted in XML, XML-RPC, JSON and PHP. Documentation is included for 14 API Kit libraries.

related_apis.title: del.icio.us API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
From their site: del.icio.us is a social bookmarking website -- the primary use of del.icio.us is to store your bookmarks online, which allows you to access the same bookmarks from any computer and add bookmarks from anywhere, too. On del.icio.us, you can use tags to organize and remember your bookmarks, which is a much more flexible system than folders.
The API provides read/write access to Delicious bookmarks and tags via an HTTP-based interface. The RESTful API returns responses in XML.

related_apis.description: [This API is no longer available. Its functions have been split among the following APIs: Facebook Ads, Facebook Atlas, Facebook Graph, and Facebook Marketing. This profile is being maintained purely for historical and research purposes.]The Facebook API is a platform for building applications that are available to the members of the social network of Facebook. The API allows applications to use the social connections and profile information to make applications more involving, and to publish activities to the news feed and profile pages of Facebook, subject to individual users privacy settings. With the API, users can add social context to their applications by utilizing profile, friend, Page, group, photo, and event data. The API uses RESTful protocol and responses are in JSON format.

The Search API methods give developers methods to interact with Twitter Search and trends data. The API presently supports the following data formats: XML, JSON, and the RSS and Atom syndication formats, with some methods only accepting a subset of these formats.

related_apis.title: LinkedIn API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
LinkedIn is the world's largest business social networking hub. Launched in 2003, LinkedIn has millions of users and is implemented in over 200 countries. One purpose of the site is to allow registered users to maintain a list of contact details of people with whom they have some level of relationship, called Connections. Users can invite anyone (whether a site user or not) to become a connection.
The LinkedIn API is a RESTful platform that provides a simple, consistent representation of people, companies, jobs, and the interactions and relationships between them. Our query language lets you read data in XML and JSON at the granularity and aggregation that you choose. Use OAuth 1.0a to authorize users and begin making REST API calls using any programming language.The API’s access is restricted to authorized developers.

related_apis.title: Thumbalizr API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Use the Thumbalizr API to submit URLs to automatically get a thumbnail image of that URL's web page contents. The thumbnails in JPG or PNG are sized according to the pixel size parameter (width) that you specify. You can also download a script to cache images locally with PHP. Also, specify the quality of the thumbnail to return, whether you want a screen or a page captured, and numerous other options. There are many options for API use: free option with no API key needed but limited features, free API key option for more features, API key paid for even more features, and API key paid with the most features.

related_apis.title: Hyves API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Use the Hyves API to get blog posts, get Hyves' user albums, view friends, view invitations, create gadgets, get user blog posts, get blog comments, create blog posts, get tips, get user information, and more. Hyves is a social site based in Europe.

title: Mashup: Hotpads
description: A map-based apartment and housing search service that uses a custom Flash-based map interface to provide users with a visually rich and interactive way to explore available properties. The mashup integrates real estate listings with geolocation data to allow for precise and intuitive property searches based on desired locations and map views. It combines real estate data sources with mapping technologies to offer a comprehensive and user-friendly platform for apartment and housing searches.

title: Mashup: MapMix
description: A location-based social networking platform that integrates mapping services with user profiles and social features. Users must register to access the mashup, which currently appears to have a limited user base. The platform enables users to connect with others nearby and discover local events, restaurants, and other points of interest through a map interface. It leverages geolocation data to provide personalized recommendations and enhance the social networking experience.

title: Mashup: Saga Earth
description: An interactive geolocation-based educational game that challenges users to identify countries on an interactive world map. Upon successful identification, the game dynamically displays videos from that country, providing a multimedia learning experience. This mashup combines mapping technology with video content to create an engaging, educational platform for understanding global geography and culture.

related_apis.title: YouTube API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
The Data API allows users to integrate their program with YouTube and allow it to perform many of the operations available on the website. It provides the capability to search for videos, retrieve standard feeds, and see related content. A program can also authenticate as a user to upload videos, modify user playlists, and more.
This integration can be used for a variety of uses such as developing a web application allowing users to upload video to YouTube, or a device or desktop application that brings the YouTube experience to a new platform. The Data API gives users programmatic access to the video and user information stored on YouTube. This can be used to personalize a web site or application with the user's existing information as well as perform actions like commenting on and rating videos. This RESTful API provides responses in XML format.

title: Mashup: Map My Following
description: An interactive map visualization tool for Twitter users that displays the geographical locations of all the accounts they follow on a Google Map. The mashup combines Twitter's API to fetch user following data with Google Maps API to plot the locations, providing users with a visual representation of their Twitter network. It's particularly useful for users interested in understanding the global distribution of their Twitter connections.

related_apis.title: Google Maps API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: [This API is no longer available. Google Maps' services have been split into multiple APIs, including the Static Maps API, Street View Image API, Directions APIs, Distance Matrix API, Elevation API, Geocoding API, Geolocation API, Places API, Roads API, and Time Zone API.This page is maintained purely for historical and research purposes.]The Google Maps API allow for the embedding of Google Maps onto web pages of outside developers, using a simple JavaScript interface or a Flash interface. It is designed to work on both mobile devices as well as traditional desktop browser applications. The API includes language localization for over 50 languages, region localization and geocoding, and has mechanisms for enterprise developers who want to utilize the Google Maps API within an intranet. The API HTTP services can be accessed over a secure (HTTPS) connection by Google Maps API Premier customers.

related_apis.title: Twitter API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: [This API is no longer available. It has been split into multiple APIs, including the Twitter Ads API, Twitter Search Tweets API, and Twitter Direct Message API.This profile is maintained for historical, research, and reference purposes only.]The Twitter micro-blogging service includes two RESTful APIs. The Twitter REST API methods allow developers to access core Twitter data. This includes update timelines, status data, and user information. The Search API methods give developers methods to interact with Twitter Search and trends data. The API presently supports the following data formats: XML, JSON, and the RSS and Atom syndication formats, with some methods only accepting a subset of these formats.

title: Mashup: Flickr Map
description: A geospatial photo sharing platform that visualizes user-submitted photographs on a dynamic map. This mashup combines geolocation data with Flickr's image database, allowing users to browse and discover photos based on their location or explore specific geographic areas. It provides an interactive way to experience visual content across different locations.

related_apis.title: Flickr API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Flickr API can be used to retrieve photos from the Flickr photo sharing service using a variety of feeds - public photos and videos, favorites, friends, group pools, discussions, and more. The API can also be used to upload photos and video.The Flickr API supports many protocols including REST, SOAP, XML-RPC. Responses can be formatted in XML, XML-RPC, JSON and PHP. Documentation is included for 14 API Kit libraries.

title: Mashup: Manhattan All Night
description: A comprehensive Google Map-based tool designed for New York City residents and visitors, providing real-time, easy-to-access information on 24-hour establishments such as delis, drug stores, and groceries. The mashup utilizes Google Maps API to display locations of these businesses, catering to the needs of individuals seeking goods and services in the bustling city even during late hours. It combines the convenience of online mapping with the practicality of local business listings, offering a user-friendly interface for quick access to necessary establishments. Note: This service may experience slow loading times due to the integration of multiple data sources and the high resolution of the map.

title: Mashup: Must See India
description: Must See India is a comprehensive trip planning and travel sharing platform that specializes in Indian tourism. By leveraging the photo-sharing capabilities of Flickr and the mapping functionalities of Google Maps, users can access a wealth of visual information about popular tourist destinations in India. The platform allows users to not only view and plan their trips but also to share their travel experiences and insights by importing their existing travel blogs, thereby creating a community-driven resource for travelers seeking authentic experiences in India.

These submissions are then aggregated and displayed on a Google map, creating a visual representation of holiday cheer across various locations. This mashup combines user-generated content with mapping technologies to foster a festive and interactive experience during the holiday season.

title: Mashup: Georeader
description: An Android application that enables users to create and share geotagged messages, which are then spoken on the device when the user enters the specified GPS location. The app includes an extensive database of more than 111,000 points, including historical markers, bridges, and even UFO sighting locations. The database covers various states such as Texas, Virginia, Georgia, Oregon, Michigan, and Pennsylvania, with the entire historical roadside marker collections and additional points across the country and even Canada. This mashup combines location services with user-generated content to provide an immersive and educational experience.

title: Mashup: Tag Mashup for Stumbleupon
description: This mashup integrates StumbleUpon user tags with real-time content from Technorati for the latest blog entries, del.icio.us for bookmark updates, and Flickr for the most recent photo uploads. The mashup dynamically fetches and displays the latest entries tagged by a StumbleUpon user or any other user's tags, providing a comprehensive view of relevant content across various media platforms.

related_apis.title: del.icio.us API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
From their site: del.icio.us is a social bookmarking website -- the primary use of del.icio.us is to store your bookmarks online, which allows you to access the same bookmarks from any computer and add bookmarks from anywhere, too. On del.icio.us, you can use tags to organize and remember your bookmarks, which is a much more flexible system than folders.
The API provides read/write access to Delicious bookmarks and tags via an HTTP-based interface. The RESTful API returns responses in XML.

title: Mashup: Toronto Events
description: A mashup that displays upcoming events in the Toronto area on a Google Maps map. It utilizes Yahoo Pipes to aggregate, sort, and geocode event data from various sources. Users can search for specific events by location or date and view them on an interactive map, facilitating easy planning and navigation.

title: Mashup: Medical Fundraising, Crisis & Disaster Map
description: A humanitarian crisis mapping mashup that leverages real-time data on global crises and disasters to identify opportunities for crowdfunding medical assistance and emergency support. Users can visualize crisis areas, understand the immediate needs, and initiate or contribute to fundraising efforts that directly impact the lives of affected individuals. This mashup combines crisis mapping data with crowdfunding platforms to facilitate rapid, targeted aid delivery.

title: Mashup: Penn State Campus Map
description: This mashup integrates the official Penn State campus map with Google Maps, providing users with a location-aware interface for searching and navigating campus buildings. The mashup combines a static map layer with real-time geolocation and search capabilities from Google Maps, allowing users to search for specific buildings by name and view their exact locations on the map. It is particularly useful for students, visitors, and faculty who need to quickly locate buildings on the Penn State campus. The mashup leverages geolocation services and building coordinates from the Penn State campus map to provide accurate, real-time location data.

title: Mashup: Photoree Image Recommendations
description: Photoree is an image recommendation service that utilizes machine learning and user behavior analysis to personalize and recommend the best images that suit your preferences, similar to how Last.fm recommends music and StumbleUpon suggests websites. It integrates social media APIs to understand user taste, adapts to individual preferences over time, and offers contextually relevant image recommendations based on user interactions and feedback.

description: serendipi Twitterous is a social media mashup that enhances Twitter feeds by integrating related content from various sources such as Yahoo search, YouTube videos, Slideshare presentations, and the OER Recommender. It analyzes the content of each tweet and retrieves relevant links and multimedia content to enrich the user's experience and provide a more comprehensive view of the topics being discussed on Twitter.

title: Mashup: AutoPal DocuSign Integration
description: AutoPal DocuSign Integration allows users to create custom forms within the AutoPal software. These forms can include embedded signatures or other tags directly in the document, or users can use the drag & drop function for more complex layouts. Once a document is created, it can be sent to customers for signing with just a click on the Ink icon. After signing, the completed document is automatically attached to the loan account. This integration leverages DocuSign's embedded signature feature and drag & drop functionality to streamline the document creation and distribution process, making it easy to manage customer communications and document workflows.

related_apis.title: DocuSign Enterprise API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
DocuSign is a Cloud based legally compliant eSignature service. DocuSign service provides an intuitive web, mobile and an API interfaces. DocuSign API allows an application to connect DocuSign service or embed parts of DocuSign user experience.
By connecting to DocuSign web services applications can create electronic signature transactions, retrieve electronically signed documents, get up to date status on outstanding envelopes and do other Create/Read/Update/Delete operations.
By embedding DocuSign interface applications can provide single-sign-on capability and insert signing or sending user experience into their applications.

title: Mashup: GP Hub
description: GP Hub is a comprehensive platform designed for tour operators to access over 50 travel service suppliers through a unified XML protocol. This approach eliminates the need for travel website owners to develop individual API integrations for each supplier, streamlining the process. The platform's scalability allows for the addition of new travel product suppliers at any time without requiring further development efforts. GP Hub's XML-interface is built on the Open Travel Alliance (OTA) standard, which is renowned for its reliability and robust security measures. This ensures a seamless and secure integration experience for all parties involved.

related_apis.title: Amadeus API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Amadeus APIs connect you to the rich travel data that powers the world’s top travel sites. Access powerful inspiration tools, flight and hotel search, booking capabilities, destination content, A.I.-powered travel insights and more to help accompany travelers through their journey and offer a complete end-to-end experience.
Amadeus is the leading IT company in the travel industry and connects you with thousands of airlines, hotels, airports, rail operators, tour agencies and other travel providers around the world.

related_apis.title: Sabre API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Sabre Travel Network is a global business-to-business travel marketplace, with the Sabre® global distribution system (GDS) at its core, and a broad set of solutions that integrate with the marketplace connects travel buyers and sellers through the world. This marketplace is used by travel suppliers including approximately 400 airlines, 125,000 hotel properties, 200 tour operators, 50 rail carriers, 27 car rental brands and 16 cruise lines to promote, personalize and sell their products through travel management companies, corporate travel departments, and to hundreds of millions of consumers using online travel sites and the services of approximately 400,000 Sabre Connected travel agents around the world.
Sabre Dev Studio is a comprehensive collection of tools and services designed to take your business to the next level. Dev Studio includes a powerful portfolio of over 100 APIs, Informational Services, Notification Services, and a variety of tools and resources.

title: Mashup: Call Transfer For Skype
description: A free call transfer service specifically designed for Skype users. This mashup offers the capability to seamlessly transfer calls between Skype-to-Skype or to Skype by name or phone number. The project includes comprehensive .NET source code for developers to integrate into their applications, as well as a standalone program example for ease of use. It leverages VOIP and telephony technologies to provide a robust communication solution for Skype users.

title: Mashup: flickrbackup
description: A Java-based utility that provides a comprehensive backup solution for all photos stored on Flickr. This tool automates the process of downloading, storing, and managing your Flickr photo collection, ensuring that all your images are securely backed up and readily accessible for future use. It integrates with Flickr’s API to retrieve and store images, offering a reliable and efficient backup service tailored for photographers and photo enthusiasts.

title: Mashup: Texas Land for Sale
description: A real estate listing service that provides an interactive map interface for browsing available properties in Texas. Users can search for and view detailed information about land parcels for sale, including property details, photos, and contact information for the listing agent. The mashup integrates with Google Maps API to display property locations and enables users to filter listings based on specific criteria such as location, size, price range, and more. This service is particularly useful for real estate agents, potential buyers, and investors looking to explore land opportunities in Texas.

description: A geotagging service that leverages Maponics' neighborhood boundary data to pinpoint the exact neighborhood of any given US address. Users input an address, and the service returns a map with the point geotagged within the corresponding neighborhood polygon, facilitating precise location-based analysis and applications.

related_apis.description: A professional-grade GIS data provider offering neighborhood boundaries dataset via an API. Also an API for neighborhood boundaries, ZIP Code boundaries and postal carrier route boundaries.

title: Mashup: Buzztap
description: Buzztap is a sports-focused mashup that offers real-time updates and news for players on your Yahoo! Fantasy Sports teams. It aggregates information from over 6,000 sources, including top fantasy sports sites, popular blogs, discussion boards, Twitter, and mainstream news organizations to provide comprehensive coverage of player performance and news.

related_apis.description:
Yahoo Fantasy Sports is the world's largest fantasy sports provider, allowing users to compete against each other using statistics from real-world competitions. The Yahoo Fantasy Sports API provides rich data on leagues, teams and player information. This data can be used to build non-commercial tools and applications that help analyze draft results, review free agents, optimize current rosters, or other apps
The Yahoo Fantasy Sports API utilizes the Yahoo Query Language (YQL) as a mechanism to access Yahoo Fantasy Sports data, returning data in XML and JSON formats.

title: Mashup: The Explorer
description: The Explorer is an innovative mashup that integrates the YouTube and New York Times APIs to provide users with a unique experience of discovering videos and staying updated with the latest news. In addition, it offers a feature that allows users to input up to five artists, and then compiles a customized music playlist based on the selected artists. This mashup enhances the user's ability to explore content from multiple sources and create a personalized listening experience.

The available facets include Times-specific fields such as sections, taxonomic classifiers and controlled vocabulary terms."

title: Mashup: PrimoSpot
description: A real-time parking availability finder for New York City and Brooklyn, PrimoSpot leverages mapping technologies and real-time data feeds to identify and display available on-street parking spots. Users can search for parking by location or view a city-wide map of available parking areas. The mashup integrates with city parking databases and utilizes geolocation services to provide accurate, location-based parking information. Currently focused on New York City and Brooklyn, the service plans to expand to other cities.

title: Mashup: SpellBoy
description: SpellBoy is a Google Gadget that provides real-time spell-checking functionality within Google services. It integrates with the Google Gadget API to offer a seamless spell-checking experience directly within Google applications. The gadget continuously monitors text input and suggests corrections to spelling errors as the user types, enhancing the accuracy and efficiency of text creation and editing tasks within Google's ecosystem.

related_apis.title: Google Gadgets API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: From their site: The Google Gadgets API provides a way to put third-party content onto the Google homepage. The main use of the Google Gadgets API is to create gadgets (mini-applications) that users can add to their Google personalized homepages and other Google properties. For example, you could create a photo album gadget, or a gadget that displays an interactive game. The API is designed to be simple enough so that anyone can turn his or her web page or application into a gadget.

title: Mashup: Flickr on Dynamo
description: A photo search and caching service that periodically downloads public photo entries from the Flickr Atom feed and stores them in Amazon DynamoDB, a highly scalable NoSQL database service. The mashup facilitates rapid photo searches and likes by leveraging DynamoDB's fast querying capabilities. This service is designed for users who need to perform quick and efficient searches across a large collection of photos, benefiting from the robustness and speed of DynamoDB.

related_apis.title: Flickr API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Flickr API can be used to retrieve photos from the Flickr photo sharing service using a variety of feeds - public photos and videos, favorites, friends, group pools, discussions, and more. The API can also be used to upload photos and video.The Flickr API supports many protocols including REST, SOAP, XML-RPC. Responses can be formatted in XML, XML-RPC, JSON and PHP. Documentation is included for 14 API Kit libraries.

related_apis.title: Amazon DynamoDB API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Amazon DynamoDB is a scalable NoSQL database homegrown by the Amazon team. Developers set their write and read capacity to match the number of reads and writes their system needs. Like all NoSQL databases, DynamoDB is not relational. So, don't expect joins or other complex queries.
The Amazon DynamoDB API contains methods for all the things you would expect from a database: create, update and delete tables; create, update, delete and retrieve items from a table.
Like other NoSQL databases, Amazon DynamoDB API is RESTful, with data returned as JSON.

title: Mashup: Album Cover Art
description: An efficient and user-friendly album cover art retrieval system that quickly fetches and displays accurate cover art for a wide range of music albums. This mashup utilizes music and art APIs to provide a seamless experience for users searching for album covers, enhancing the visual aspect of music consumption.

related_apis.title: Amazon Product Advertising API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: What was formerly the ECS - eCommerce Service - has been renamed the Product Advertising API. Through this API developers can retrieve product information. The API exposes Amazon's product data and e-commerce functionality. This allows developers, web site publishers and others to leverage the Amazon Product Discovery features that Amazon uses to power its own business, and potentially make money as an Amazon affiliate. Additionally, the API has features allowing developers to advertise proucts, let users search for Amazon products and help users discover Amazon products. Both REST and SOAP APIs are provided, this profile is for the REST API.

versions.version_title: Amazon Product Advertising REST API v1.0
Amazon Product Advertising REST API v5.0

title: Mashup: Banned Books
description: A data-mining tool that demonstrates how government agencies could use Amazon wishlists to create profiles of individuals based on the books they read. The mashup uses Amazon's API to access user wishlists and then applies data-mining techniques to identify potential subversives. It serves as an educational tool to raise awareness about the potential misuse of personal data.

versions.version_title: Amazon Product Advertising REST API v1.0
Amazon Product Advertising REST API v5.0

related_apis.title: Google Maps API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: [This API is no longer available. Google Maps' services have been split into multiple APIs, including the Static Maps API, Street View Image API, Directions APIs, Distance Matrix API, Elevation API, Geocoding API, Geolocation API, Places API, Roads API, and Time Zone API.This page is maintained purely for historical and research purposes.]The Google Maps API allow for the embedding of Google Maps onto web pages of outside developers, using a simple JavaScript interface or a Flash interface. It is designed to work on both mobile devices as well as traditional desktop browser applications. The API includes language localization for over 50 languages, region localization and geocoding, and has mechanisms for enterprise developers who want to utilize the Google Maps API within an intranet. The API HTTP services can be accessed over a secure (HTTPS) connection by Google Maps API Premier customers.

title: Mashup: TodoToday for Teambox
description: TodoToday Pro for Teambox is a comprehensive task management application that integrates with the online collaboration and project management platform, Teambox. This mashup allows users to access, manage, and visualize their current task lists in real-time directly within the TodoToday Pro interface. It provides a seamless workflow for managing tasks, enhancing productivity, and streamlining communication among team members. The application supports multiple users and projects, ensuring that all team members have synchronized and up-to-date task lists. Users can categorize tasks, set priorities, and track progress, all while maintaining a clear overview of their responsibilities and deadlines. Additionally, it offers features such as task delegation, notifications, and reporting to help teams stay organized and informed. This mashup is designed for individuals and teams who need a robust task management solution that can scale with their growing needs.

related_apis.title: Redbooth API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Redbooth is a collaboration and communication platform with a publicly available API with the following key features:
(1) OAuth support
(2) Flat structure, both in the input and output
(3) Supports pagination and partial response for enhanced performance
(4) Specific error reporting
(5) Developer portal with full documentation and a testing console
(6) Code snippets to quick-start developers

title: Mashup: Pushpins
description: A web and mobile application offering a user-friendly interface for searching, saving, and redeeming digital coupons for grocery and drug store products. Pushpins integrates with the Yummly API to provide a comprehensive database of coupons, eliminating the need for traditional paper coupons. Users can save coupons for their next shopping trip, and redeem them by scanning the barcode of the product in-store. Pushpins is available in over 10,000 grocery and drug stores, providing a convenient and efficient couponing solution for consumers.

related_apis.title: Yummly API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
The Yummly Recipe API lets you lets you integrate recipes and faceted recipe search into your websites or mobile applications.
Since Yummly understands the recipe â€“ingredients, diets, allergies, nutrition, taste, techniques & moreâ€“ we can connect your users with the best recipes available for their unique food preferences.

title: Mashup: Spot2be App
description: Spot2be App is a location-sharing platform that leverages URL shortening technology to enable users to share their precise locations quickly and easily across multiple devices. It integrates mapping services with messaging and social features, allowing users to send short URLs representing their locations to friends or groups, facilitating real-time location sharing and coordination. The service is designed to be user-friendly, with a focus on ease of use and quick accessibility.

related_apis.title: Facebook API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: [This API is no longer available. Its functions have been split among the following APIs: Facebook Ads, Facebook Atlas, Facebook Graph, and Facebook Marketing. This profile is being maintained purely for historical and research purposes.]The Facebook API is a platform for building applications that are available to the members of the social network of Facebook. The API allows applications to use the social connections and profile information to make applications more involving, and to publish activities to the news feed and profile pages of Facebook, subject to individual users privacy settings. With the API, users can add social context to their applications by utilizing profile, friend, Page, group, photo, and event data. The API uses RESTful protocol and responses are in JSON format.

related_apis.title: Twitter API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: [This API is no longer available. It has been split into multiple APIs, including the Twitter Ads API, Twitter Search Tweets API, and Twitter Direct Message API.This profile is maintained for historical, research, and reference purposes only.]The Twitter micro-blogging service includes two RESTful APIs. The Twitter REST API methods allow developers to access core Twitter data. This includes update timelines, status data, and user information. The Search API methods give developers methods to interact with Twitter Search and trends data. The API presently supports the following data formats: XML, JSON, and the RSS and Atom syndication formats, with some methods only accepting a subset of these formats.

title: Mashup: Brainsell-Technologies + DocuSign
description: Brainsell-Technologies is a business solutions company that offers comprehensive ERP, CRM, and marketing automation solutions, services, training, implementation, and software development to help businesses grow and create a delighted customer base. Since 2013, Brainsell has been a partner of DocuSign, integrating DocuSign with Salesforce, SugarCRM, and Microsoft Dynamics to provide electronic signature solutions, enhancing business processes and customer interactions.

related_apis.title: DocuSign Enterprise API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
DocuSign is a Cloud based legally compliant eSignature service. DocuSign service provides an intuitive web, mobile and an API interfaces. DocuSign API allows an application to connect DocuSign service or embed parts of DocuSign user experience.
By connecting to DocuSign web services applications can create electronic signature transactions, retrieve electronically signed documents, get up to date status on outstanding envelopes and do other Create/Read/Update/Delete operations.
By embedding DocuSign interface applications can provide single-sign-on capability and insert signing or sending user experience into their applications.

title: Mashup: Music Spider
description: Music Spider is a music and video aggregation platform that utilizes YouTube's vast content to cater to diverse music enthusiast needs. It allows users to explore regional and genre-specific music, discover related artists, and create personalized playlists or 'stations' for background music. Stations can be shared via Facebook, enabling users to connect socially with music preferences. Key features include aggregation of various music content types, social sharing integration, and playlist creation for personalized music experiences.

related_apis.title: YouTube API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
The Data API allows users to integrate their program with YouTube and allow it to perform many of the operations available on the website. It provides the capability to search for videos, retrieve standard feeds, and see related content. A program can also authenticate as a user to upload videos, modify user playlists, and more.
This integration can be used for a variety of uses such as developing a web application allowing users to upload video to YouTube, or a device or desktop application that brings the YouTube experience to a new platform. The Data API gives users programmatic access to the video and user information stored on YouTube. This can be used to personalize a web site or application with the user's existing information as well as perform actions like commenting on and rating videos. This RESTful API provides responses in XML format.

related_apis.title: Last.fm API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Last.fm API gives users the ability to build programs using Last.fm data, whether on the web, the desktop or mobile devices. The RESTful API allows for read and write access to the full slate of last.fm music data resources - albums, artists, playlists, events, users, and more. It allows users to call methods that respond in either XML or JSON.

related_apis.title: Facebook Graph API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Graph API is a simple, consistent view of the Facebook social graph, that uniformly represents objects in the graph and may include people, photos, events, and pages etc., the connections between them, friend relationships, shared content, and more. Public information can be accessed without a developer key/application key, but is required for private data access. Facebook Developers enables you to build, grow and monetize amazing applications.

title: Mashup: Vermont Jobs Site
description: A job classifieds site for Vermont that combines a job search engine, classified ads placement, saved job listings functionality, and an events calendar for job fairs and related activities. Job seekers can find and save job listings, while employers can post job openings and participate in job fairs. The mashup supports local employment by focusing on job opportunities within Vermont.

title: Mashup: TourCMS Marketplace Widgets
description: Integrate the TourCMS Marketplace API with your website to display dynamic, real-time travel product information. These small JavaScript snippets enable third parties to seamlessly embed travel product listings, such as tours, activities, and accommodations, from the TourCMS Marketplace into their website's interface. This allows for the presentation of relevant travel products in specified areas or regions, enhancing the user experience and providing a direct link to book these products through the integrated API.

related_apis.title: TourCMS Marketplace API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: TourCMS provides a full website and reservation management system for small and medium sized tour operators. These API calls are to access your live product data in realtime. They can be used by TourCMS Marketplace partners to access content from multiple TourCMS accounts. These APIs can also be used by individual account owners to access their own data.

title: Mashup: naksha
description: A comprehensive mapping mashup for Pakistan, enabling detailed home address search across the country. This mashup combines geospatial data with address verification to provide accurate location information for residential and commercial properties. It is designed to assist users in navigating and searching for specific addresses within Pakistan, offering a valuable tool for both personal and business use.

title: Mashup: Visual eBay
description: A visual eBay search tool integrated with Google Maps API, enabling users to search eBay items and instantly visualize their locations on a Google Map. This mashup combines eBay's search functionality with Google Maps' geospatial data for a location-based search experience, allowing users to find and track eBay items in real-time, and potentially navigate to physical locations where the items are being sold.

title: Mashup: pinkbigmac
description: A virtual exploration web application that allows users to discover and learn about various destinations worldwide. The platform provides interactive visual tours, detailed historical context, cultural significance, popularity, and other relevant information for each location, enhancing users' understanding and appreciation of the destinations they visit virtually.

related_apis.title: Google Custom Search API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Google Custom Search Engine API is a RESTful API that allows developer to get web or image search results data in JSON or Atom format. With the API, developers can add web search and/or site search capabilities to their website, blog or collection of websites.

versions.version_title: Google Custom Search REST API v1

related_apis.title: Yelp Fusion API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Yelp Fusion APIs are RESTful APIs and users can retrieve business review and rating, information for a particular geographic region or location.display review information for a particular business, determine accurate neighborhood name information for a particular location, track recent reviews for a particular business, display pictures of highly rated local businesses and of the top reviewers for that business, determine a particular business' review and rating information based on the phone number for that business. The default output is JSON. This output format was chosen due to the availability of JSON parsers in many languages. The following Yelp Fusion APIs are available: Search, Phone Number Search, Business Search, Transaction, Reviews, and Autcomplete - each API has a separate ProgrammableWeb entry.

related_apis.title: Foursquare API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Foursquare Places API provides location based experiences with diverse information about venues, users, photos, and check-ins. The API supports real time access to places, Snap-to-Place that assigns users to specific locations, and Geo-tag. Additionally, Foursquare allows developers to build audience segments for analysis and measurement. JSON is the preferred response format.

related_apis.title: EasyToBook API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Update: Soon, Easytobook will release a REST API.
Easytobook provides hotel bookings for more than 120,000 hotels in over 9,000 cities. The Easytobook API provides a SOAP-based API to facilitate hotel searching and booking applications. Developers can retrieve a list of cities, get hotels for a particular city, check hotel availability, look for cheap hotel rooms, get other room information, retrieve hotel photos and other hotel information, as well as book the hotel on behalf of their users. Developers can also retrieve specific booking information, to be built into their customer service applications.
The API also has an affiliate program to pay out a percentage of booking fees to developers. Because the API uses SOAP, data is formatted as XML.

related_apis.title: Google Analytics Managment API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Use the Google Analytics Management API to leverage Google's extensive website analytics tools. The API uses GET requests over HTTPS and JSON for requests/returns. Some of the functions available with the API are: List Account, Property and View (Profile) information for a user; manage properties and goals; manage user permissions; and upload cost data to Google Analytics for non-Google paid campaigns. See the extensive documentation for code samples, detailed method descriptions, and more.

related_apis.title: Google AdSense API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
The Google AdSense API is ideal for developers whose users create their own content through blogging, web publishing, forum/wiki/community creation, or any other application where substantial web content is generated.
Using the AdSense API, developers can let users sign up for AdSense through their site or program, generate detailed performance reports for users, and choose how the AdSense revenue is shared with our revenue sharing program. Additionally users can create accounts to store publisher website information, then generate ad code snippets and filter out unwanted ads.
A previous SOAP version has been deprecated in favor of REST with responses formatted as JSON.

related_apis.title: Mapbox API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Mapbox is a suite of open source mapping tools. This API can be used to create interactive maps using a wide range of file formats and databases. It also allows users to host their maps so that they can be embedded on webpages and shared with a wider audience. All maps created using Mapbox are compatible with Android and iOS devices.

related_apis.title: Amazon S3 API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Since 2006 Amazon Web Services has been offering web services commonly known as cloud computing. AWS Provides a reliable, low cost infrastructure platform that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses.
Amazon S3 API, the Simple Storage Service provides a simple web services interface used to store objects using the Amazon online storage infrastructure. Users can then download the data or use the data with other AWS services, such as Amazon Elastic Cloud Computer (EC2). Using this web service, developers can build applications that make use of Internet storage.
The API uses Buckets, Objects, Keys and Operations. An object has four parts: value, key, metadata, and an access control policy. Objects are stored in buckets. The API is REST based. Responses are formatted in JSON.

related_apis.title: ElasticSearch API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
ElasticSearch is a data analysis, monitoring, and search platform. ElasticSearch provides multiple products for monitoring, searching, and organizing data.
The ElasticSearch API allows developers to access and integrate the functionality of ElasticSearch with other applications. API documentation is not available; API access comes with account service.

related_apis.title: World Weather Online API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: [This API is no longer available. Its functions have been split among the following APIs: World Weather Online City Search, World Weather Online Time Zone, World Weather Online Ski and Mountain, World Weather Online Historical or Past Weather, World Weather Online Local City Weather, World Weather Online Marine, Sailing, Surfing Weather, and World Weather Online Ski Weather. This profile is being maintained purely for historical and research purposes.]World Weather Online provides weather forecast and weather api content for worldwide city and towns. The Developer Weather API allows developers and programmers to access free 5 day weather feed in XML, JSON and CSV format for any location by UK Postcode, Canada Postal code, US Zipcode, City and Town name (country and state/region filter) or by using Latitude and Longitude.

title: Mashup: Clipegg
description: Clipegg is a social media-driven, multimedia aggregation platform that curates and presents the most popular news, videos, and images from various social media sites. By leveraging social media data, it offers users a quick and easy way to access trending content across multiple platforms, enhancing their media consumption experience through a centralized hub of popular media.

title: Mashup: Actually
description: Actually is a comprehensive photo aggregation platform that collects and displays images sourced from Instagram, Flickr, and 500px. This mashup utilizes APIs from each of these platforms to gather a diverse range of photographic content, providing users with a rich and varied experience. The mashup supports various user interactions, including browsing, searching, and sharing. It leverages the strengths of each platform, offering access to both professional and amateur photography, and enables users to explore a wide array of photographic content from around the world, all in one place.

Users take photos and can share them with Instagram contacts, as well as friends on other social networks like Twitter and Facebook. The Instagram API provides access to user authentication, friend connections, photos and all the other elements of the iPhone app--including uploading new media.

related_apis.title: 500px API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: This API is no longer publicly available, please email sales@500px.com to discuss further usage of the API. 500px is an online community for photographers and fans of photography. Photographers can upload their pictures to share with other 500px users, and all users can browse and search the photo collection for discovery and artistic inspiration. The 500px API allows developers to access and integrate the functionality and content of 500px. Some example API methods include searching and retrieving photos, uploading photos, and finding users.

title: Mashup: MarineTraffic.com: Live Ships Map
description: A real-time vessel tracking and mapping service that provides live positions, types, and names of thousands of ships. Users can create an account to monitor specific vessels by adding them to their fleet, and in some cases, view photographs of the ships. The service integrates various data sources, including AIS (Automatic Identification System) signals, to provide up-to-date and accurate information on global ship movements.

title: Mashup: YouFM
description: A music and video streaming mashup that combines Last.fm's artist data with YouTube's video content to provide a unique, artist-focused radio experience. Users can listen to tracks from their favorite artists while simultaneously viewing visual content related to the currently playing song. The mashup leverages APIs from both Last.fm and YouTube to dynamically update and synchronize the audio and video streams, ensuring that users get a comprehensive and engaging entertainment experience.

related_apis.title: YouTube API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
The Data API allows users to integrate their program with YouTube and allow it to perform many of the operations available on the website. It provides the capability to search for videos, retrieve standard feeds, and see related content. A program can also authenticate as a user to upload videos, modify user playlists, and more.
This integration can be used for a variety of uses such as developing a web application allowing users to upload video to YouTube, or a device or desktop application that brings the YouTube experience to a new platform. The Data API gives users programmatic access to the video and user information stored on YouTube. This can be used to personalize a web site or application with the user's existing information as well as perform actions like commenting on and rating videos. This RESTful API provides responses in XML format.

related_apis.title: Last.fm API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Last.fm API gives users the ability to build programs using Last.fm data, whether on the web, the desktop or mobile devices. The RESTful API allows for read and write access to the full slate of last.fm music data resources - albums, artists, playlists, events, users, and more. It allows users to call methods that respond in either XML or JSON.

related_apis.title: Bit.ly API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: bit.ly allows users to shorten, share, and track links (URLs). Reducing the URL length makes sharing easier. bit.ly can be accessed through their website, bookmarklets and this open API. bit.ly is also integrated into several popular third-party tools such as Tweetdeck and is used extensively on services like Twitter. Unique user-level and aggregate links can be created and let users view complete, real-time traffic and referrer data, as well as location and metadata.

title: Mashup: Wifi and Plugs
description: An app that aggregates data from Import.io and user submissions to provide a comprehensive list of locations in London where Wi-Fi and electrical outlets are available. Users can search for and locate these places, ensuring they have access to Wi-Fi and power during their visit. The mashup enhances the user experience by combining real-time data and user contributions into a single, easy-to-use platform.

related_apis.title: import.io API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Import.io is easy to use web extraction that puts the world’s data in your hands.
The import.io API allows developers to access and integrate the functionality of import.io with other applications. Some example API methods include retrieving data, importing data, extracting data, and managing account information. Sign up for a free trial at https://www.import.io.

related_apis.title: Mapbox API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Mapbox is a suite of open source mapping tools. This API can be used to create interactive maps using a wide range of file formats and databases. It also allows users to host their maps so that they can be embedded on webpages and shared with a wider audience. All maps created using Mapbox are compatible with Android and iOS devices.

title: Mashup: Homethinking
description: Homethinking is a real estate transaction monitoring service that integrates real estate databases with agent performance tracking and customer review systems. The mashup provides a comprehensive overview of real estate transactions, including agent performance metrics and customer feedback. It combines real estate transaction data with agent review APIs to offer insights into the effectiveness of real estate agents and the quality of their work.

title: Mashup: Adhysteria
description: An online classifieds and advertisements service that integrates video, image, and audio content with Google Maps. Users can post multimedia advertisements and view classified listings on an interactive map, providing a visual and geographical context for each listing.

related_apis.title: Google AdWords API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Google AdWords API allows apps to interact directly with the Google Ads platform, vastly increasing the efficiency of managing large or complex Google Ads accounts and campaigns. Some typical use cases include:Automated account managementCustom reportingAd management based on inventoryBid management based on business dataWith the AdWords API you can build software that manages accounts from the customer level down to the keyword level. The API can do almost everything the Google Ads UI does, but programmatically.The types of companies that have benefited from the AdWords API include:Ad agenciesSearch Engine Marketing (SEM) companiesBig brands managing a large number of accounts, with needs beyond what's possible within the Google Ads UI.The API relies on SOAP and WSDL technologies to offer its services. You set up API access by obtaining a few required authentication credentials, creating some test accounts, and adding the authentication and account details to a configuration file for your client library. Authentication is via OAuth2.To help you get started, they offer client libraries in Java, .NET, Python, PHP, Perl, and Ruby.

related_apis.title: Google Maps API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: [This API is no longer available. Google Maps' services have been split into multiple APIs, including the Static Maps API, Street View Image API, Directions APIs, Distance Matrix API, Elevation API, Geocoding API, Geolocation API, Places API, Roads API, and Time Zone API.This page is maintained purely for historical and research purposes.]The Google Maps API allow for the embedding of Google Maps onto web pages of outside developers, using a simple JavaScript interface or a Flash interface. It is designed to work on both mobile devices as well as traditional desktop browser applications. The API includes language localization for over 50 languages, region localization and geocoding, and has mechanisms for enterprise developers who want to utilize the Google Maps API within an intranet. The API HTTP services can be accessed over a secure (HTTPS) connection by Google Maps API Premier customers.

related_apis.title: Vast API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Vast is a web search service that crawls the entire web and structure the data it finds. Initial verticals include Cars, Jobs, Profiles.

related_apis.title: Google AdSense API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
The Google AdSense API is ideal for developers whose users create their own content through blogging, web publishing, forum/wiki/community creation, or any other application where substantial web content is generated.
Using the AdSense API, developers can let users sign up for AdSense through their site or program, generate detailed performance reports for users, and choose how the AdSense revenue is shared with our revenue sharing program. Additionally users can create accounts to store publisher website information, then generate ad code snippets and filter out unwanted ads.
A previous SOAP version has been deprecated in favor of REST with responses formatted as JSON.

title: Mashup: TubeGotChi Music
description: A music video integration mashup that combines the Billboard music chart with YouTube's video streaming service. This mashup displays the top 10 songs from the weekly Billboard music chart in the form of YouTube music videos, enabling users to watch and listen to popular music directly through the mashup. It integrates Billboard's music chart data with YouTube's video content to provide a seamless music video streaming experience.

title: Mashup: SkyChalk
description: SkyChalk is an innovative location-based communication platform that allows users to post messages to any geographical location, enabling real-time interaction with people around them. This mashup combines mapping technologies with social messaging, providing a unique way for individuals to engage in digital conversations with their local communities. By leveraging geolocation services and social media integration, SkyChalk facilitates spontaneous communication and interaction based on physical proximity, making it a dynamic tool for local engagement and community building.

related_apis.title: Google Fusion Tables API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Google Fusion Tables is a free service for sharing and visualizing data online. It lets you upload data, share and mark up your data with collaborators, merge data from multiple tables, and create visualizations such as charts and maps. The API lets you update and query your dataset in Fusion Tables programmatically. The API lets you import data from other data sources, whether a text file or a full database.

related_apis.title: Google Geocoding API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Google Geocoding API is a webservice for the Google Maps API. The Geocoding API provides a direct way to access a geocoder via an HTTP request, though it must be used in conjunction with Google Maps. Additionally, the service allows you to perform the converse operation (turning coordinates into addresses); this process is known as "reverse geocoding." Also, you can choose to limit your search to certain bounded areas (Viewport Biasing) or regions (Region Biasing).

title: Mashup: Message in a Bottle
description: An anonymous messaging platform that allows users to send and receive messages from anywhere, either via the web or phone. The platform provides features such as getting anonymous replies, re-shares, and likes, with the goal of becoming anonymously famous. It integrates messaging services with anonymity protocols to ensure privacy and security.

related_apis.title: Twilio API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Twilio provides a simple hosted API and markup language for businesses to quickly build scalable, reliable and advanced voice and SMS communications applications. Twilio provides a telephony infrastructure web service "in the cloud", enabling web programmers to integrate real-time phone calls into their applications. Twilio's simple Pay-As-You-Go pricing model means customers pay for capacity only when they need it, not before. Voice applications written on Twilio's cloud solution scale transparently, eliminating programming, operational and contractual headaches frequently associated with rapid growth or traffic spikes.
Twilio provides a cloud API for voice and SMS communications that leverages existing web development skills, resources and infrastructure. It minimizes the learning curve required to build advanced, reliable voice communications applications that solve critical business needs. The syntax and programming model are focused on making application development as close to the request/response model of web application development as possible. The API uses a RESTful interface and responses are formatted in HTML, JSON, XML or CSV.

title: Mashup: iBegin Local Search
description: A user-driven local search service that allows individuals to contribute listings, reviews, pictures, tags, and other relevant information. The mashup is specifically focused on the Toronto area and provides a mapped view of traffic conditions, enhancing the user experience with real-time traffic updates. It leverages user-generated content to create a comprehensive local search directory, integrating with mapping services to offer a detailed and interactive user interface for navigating the city and finding relevant locations based on user input.

title: Mashup: Japan Talent Data Box
description: A comprehensive directory service for Japanese talents, including actors, actresses, and models, with integrated social networking features to promote their work and connect with fans. The mashup combines talent profiles with social media integration, allowing users to follow, share, and interact with the talents' updates. It serves as a central hub for discovering and engaging with Japanese entertainment personalities.

related_apis.title: Amazon S3 API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Since 2006 Amazon Web Services has been offering web services commonly known as cloud computing. AWS Provides a reliable, low cost infrastructure platform that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses.
Amazon S3 API, the Simple Storage Service provides a simple web services interface used to store objects using the Amazon online storage infrastructure. Users can then download the data or use the data with other AWS services, such as Amazon Elastic Cloud Computer (EC2). Using this web service, developers can build applications that make use of Internet storage.
The API uses Buckets, Objects, Keys and Operations. An object has four parts: value, key, metadata, and an access control policy. Objects are stored in buckets. The API is REST based. Responses are formatted in JSON.

related_apis.title: Twitter API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: [This API is no longer available. It has been split into multiple APIs, including the Twitter Ads API, Twitter Search Tweets API, and Twitter Direct Message API.This profile is maintained for historical, research, and reference purposes only.]The Twitter micro-blogging service includes two RESTful APIs. The Twitter REST API methods allow developers to access core Twitter data. This includes update timelines, status data, and user information. The Search API methods give developers methods to interact with Twitter Search and trends data. The API presently supports the following data formats: XML, JSON, and the RSS and Atom syndication formats, with some methods only accepting a subset of these formats.

title: Mashup: MICE Meets Metropolis
description: A business-oriented mashup that leverages the Google Maps Javascript API and Flash FLEX Google maps to provide a comprehensive directory of services, hotels, and facilities in the regions of Amsterdam and Utrecht, Netherlands. The mashup enhances the user experience by integrating geolocation technologies with a user-friendly interface, enabling users to easily search for and locate key business services and accommodations. It focuses on providing real-time, accurate information to professionals and businesses looking to operate in the specified regions, thereby facilitating better decision-making and planning.

title: Mashup: News on a Timeline
description: A news aggregation service that combines RSS data from various news sources such as Google News and Reuters, and displays the aggregated news on a Timeline widget. The service uses MIT Simile timeline technology for visualizing news articles in chronological order, enabling users to browse through news stories efficiently and quickly filter out irrelevant content.

related_apis.title: del.icio.us API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
From their site: del.icio.us is a social bookmarking website -- the primary use of del.icio.us is to store your bookmarks online, which allows you to access the same bookmarks from any computer and add bookmarks from anywhere, too. On del.icio.us, you can use tags to organize and remember your bookmarks, which is a much more flexible system than folders.
The API provides read/write access to Delicious bookmarks and tags via an HTTP-based interface. The RESTful API returns responses in XML.

title: Mashup: GeiKnows
description: This mashup displays traditional Japanese arts on a map. It features a comprehensive collection of Japanese traditional arts and their locations, providing users with an interactive and visually rich experience to explore these arts. By integrating mapping technologies with the database of Japanese traditional arts, the mashup offers a unique way to discover and appreciate the cultural heritage of Japan.

title: Mashup: Reedy Creek Greenway
description: An interactive Google Map mashup that highlights the newly established North Carolina greenway connecting Umstead park and Lake Crabtree trails to the Raleigh greenway system. This map offers a unique exploration experience by integrating with Flickr to display user-submitted photos and descriptions of various points along the greenway, as well as providing access to related news articles. Users can interactively engage with the map to explore, view, and contribute to the greenway's online community and resources.

title: Mashup: Dear Map
description: A collaborative mapping platform that allows users to create, customize, and share their own maps with friends and the community. The mashup integrates user-generated content with mapping APIs to provide a personalized and social mapping experience.
