title: Mashup: We-Wired Web
description: We-Wired Web is a community-oriented platform that provides non-technical users with an intuitive interface to seamlessly share and integrate data across various web services. The platform is designed to be extensible, enabling technical users to enhance its functionality by integrating new web services, setting up triggers, and defining actions through visual wiring diagrams. This approach empowers both technical and non-technical users to create custom data sharing and integration workflows without the need for extensive coding knowledge.

related_apis.title: Flickr API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Flickr API can be used to retrieve photos from the Flickr photo sharing service using a variety of feeds - public photos and videos, favorites, friends, group pools, discussions, and more. The API can also be used to upload photos and video.The Flickr API supports many protocols including REST, SOAP, XML-RPC. Responses can be formatted in XML, XML-RPC, JSON and PHP. Documentation is included for 14 API Kit libraries.

related_apis.title: Blogger API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Blogger Data API allows client applications to view and update Blogger content in the form of Google Data API feeds. Your client application can use the Data API to create new blog posts, edit or delete existing posts, and query for posts that match particular criteria.

related_apis.title: del.icio.us API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
From their site: del.icio.us is a social bookmarking website -- the primary use of del.icio.us is to store your bookmarks online, which allows you to access the same bookmarks from any computer and add bookmarks from anywhere, too. On del.icio.us, you can use tags to organize and remember your bookmarks, which is a much more flexible system than folders.
The API provides read/write access to Delicious bookmarks and tags via an HTTP-based interface. The RESTful API returns responses in XML.

related_apis.title: YouTube API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
The Data API allows users to integrate their program with YouTube and allow it to perform many of the operations available on the website. It provides the capability to search for videos, retrieve standard feeds, and see related content. A program can also authenticate as a user to upload videos, modify user playlists, and more.
This integration can be used for a variety of uses such as developing a web application allowing users to upload video to YouTube, or a device or desktop application that brings the YouTube experience to a new platform. The Data API gives users programmatic access to the video and user information stored on YouTube. This can be used to personalize a web site or application with the user's existing information as well as perform actions like commenting on and rating videos. This RESTful API provides responses in XML format.

related_apis.title: Last.fm API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Last.fm API gives users the ability to build programs using Last.fm data, whether on the web, the desktop or mobile devices. The RESTful API allows for read and write access to the full slate of last.fm music data resources - albums, artists, playlists, events, users, and more. It allows users to call methods that respond in either XML or JSON.

related_apis.title: Google Talk API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: From the site: As long as you adhere to the requirements of the XMPP specs, you should be able to connect to the Google Talk service. Other clients that can connect include [[http://gaim.sourceforge.net/ GAIM]] and [[http://www.ceruleanstudios.com/learn/ Trillian Pro]].

related_apis.title: Google Calendar API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
The Calendar Data API lets users perform most of the operations a normal Google Calendar user can on the Google Calendar website. Google Calendar allows client applications to view and update calendar events in the form of Google data API, GData, feeds. The Calendar Data API lets users incorporate Calendar functionality into their own application or website. Users can edit calendars, create and delete events, query for events that match particular criteria, send invitations, and more.
There are many possible uses for the Calendar data API. For example, users can create a web front end for a group calendar that uses Google Calendar as a back end. Or a public calendar can be generated for Google Calendar to display, based on a company event database. Or users can search relevant calendars to display a list of upcoming events on those calendars.

related_apis.title: Twitter API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: [This API is no longer available. It has been split into multiple APIs, including the Twitter Ads API, Twitter Search Tweets API, and Twitter Direct Message API.This profile is maintained for historical, research, and reference purposes only.]The Twitter micro-blogging service includes two RESTful APIs. The Twitter REST API methods allow developers to access core Twitter data. This includes update timelines, status data, and user information. The Search API methods give developers methods to interact with Twitter Search and trends data. The API presently supports the following data formats: XML, JSON, and the RSS and Atom syndication formats, with some methods only accepting a subset of these formats.

related_apis.title: Yelp Fusion API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Yelp Fusion APIs are RESTful APIs and users can retrieve business review and rating, information for a particular geographic region or location.display review information for a particular business, determine accurate neighborhood name information for a particular location, track recent reviews for a particular business, display pictures of highly rated local businesses and of the top reviewers for that business, determine a particular business' review and rating information based on the phone number for that business. The default output is JSON. This output format was chosen due to the availability of JSON parsers in many languages. The following Yelp Fusion APIs are available: Search, Phone Number Search, Business Search, Transaction, Reviews, and Autcomplete - each API has a separate ProgrammableWeb entry.

related_apis.title: Vimeo API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Let Vimeo take care of all your video needs. Their API handles uploading, transcoding, hosting and playback of any video type. Embed the videos in your own website, or share them with the large community of filmmakers that call Vimeo home. The API uses RESTful calls and responses are formatted in JSON

related_apis.title: LinkedIn API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
LinkedIn is the world's largest business social networking hub. Launched in 2003, LinkedIn has millions of users and is implemented in over 200 countries. One purpose of the site is to allow registered users to maintain a list of contact details of people with whom they have some level of relationship, called Connections. Users can invite anyone (whether a site user or not) to become a connection.
The LinkedIn API is a RESTful platform that provides a simple, consistent representation of people, companies, jobs, and the interactions and relationships between them. Our query language lets you read data in XML and JSON at the granularity and aggregation that you choose. Use OAuth 1.0a to authorize users and begin making REST API calls using any programming language.The API’s access is restricted to authorized developers.

related_apis.title: Tumblr API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Tumblr API allows users to read and write Tumblr blog and post data, retrieve posts by tags, get user information, follow blogs and like posts. Data is formatted in JSON and support for JSONP is included.

related_apis.title: Plurk API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Plurk is a site that allows you to showcase the events that make up your life, and follow the events of the people that matter to you, in short messages called plurks. The Plurk API provides a standard way of accessing and implementing applications on top of the Plurk platform. The API is a simple HTTP API that can be accessed from any language that supports creation of HTTP requests.

related_apis.title: SoundCloud API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: SoundCloud is the leading audio platform that enables anyone to upload, record, promote and share their sounds across the web. The SoundCloud API makes most of the features from SoundCloud.com available to app developers. With the help of its SDKs it's easy to integrate functionality like audio sharing and recording directly into iOS, Android and web apps.

related_apis.title: Bit.ly API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: bit.ly allows users to shorten, share, and track links (URLs). Reducing the URL length makes sharing easier. bit.ly can be accessed through their website, bookmarklets and this open API. bit.ly is also integrated into several popular third-party tools such as Tweetdeck and is used extensively on services like Twitter. Unique user-level and aggregate links can be created and let users view complete, real-time traffic and referrer data, as well as location and metadata.

related_apis.title: Yammer API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Yammer is a private social network for companies. The tool was originally for making companies and organizations more productive through the exchange of short frequent answers to one simple question: "What are you working on?" The Yammer API allows third-party developers to create their own Yammer applications.

related_apis.title: Twilio API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Twilio provides a simple hosted API and markup language for businesses to quickly build scalable, reliable and advanced voice and SMS communications applications. Twilio provides a telephony infrastructure web service "in the cloud", enabling web programmers to integrate real-time phone calls into their applications. Twilio's simple Pay-As-You-Go pricing model means customers pay for capacity only when they need it, not before. Voice applications written on Twilio's cloud solution scale transparently, eliminating programming, operational and contractual headaches frequently associated with rapid growth or traffic spikes.
Twilio provides a cloud API for voice and SMS communications that leverages existing web development skills, resources and infrastructure. It minimizes the learning curve required to build advanced, reliable voice communications applications that solve critical business needs. The syntax and programming model are focused on making application development as close to the request/response model of web application development as possible. The API uses a RESTful interface and responses are formatted in HTML, JSON, XML or CSV.

related_apis.title: Diigo API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Diigo provides a browser add-on that can improve your research productivity. As you read on the web, instead of just bookmarking, you can highlight portions of web pages that are of particular interest to you. You can also attach sticky notes to specific parts of web pages.

related_apis.title: Yahoo Weather API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Yahoo Weather API allows developers to integrate weather information for any location into third-party applications. Available information includes the 5-day forecast, wind, atmospheric conditions, precipitation, sunset time, astronomy conditions, and more. Developers can look up weather by WOEID (Where On Earth IDentifier), city name, or lat/long coordinates.

related_apis.title: Pocket API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Previously offered under the name Read It Later, Pocket is a service that allows users to save articles, videos and more to read or use later. The Pocket API allows for applications that interact with the Pocket service. The API can be used to build a full featured Pocket client for any platform, mashup reading list data, or allow users to save pages to their list from an application. The API can be used in both free and commercial applications.

related_apis.title: Foursquare API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Foursquare Places API provides location based experiences with diverse information about venues, users, photos, and check-ins. The API supports real time access to places, Snap-to-Place that assigns users to specific locations, and Geo-tag. Additionally, Foursquare allows developers to build audience segments for analysis and measurement. JSON is the preferred response format.

related_apis.title: Twilio SMS API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Twilio SMS API allows developers to send and receive SMS messages, track sent messages, and retrieve and modify message history from their applications. This API uses a RESTful interface over HTTPS.Twilio is a cloud communications platform that provides tools for adding messaging, voice, and video to web and mobile applications.

related_apis.title: Dropbox API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Dropbox is a storage service that syncs files online and across your computers via installed software. The API allows read/write access to the same files, piggybacking on Dropbox's file synchronization and storage.

related_apis.title: Instagram Graph API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Instagram is a photo sharing iPhone app and service. Users take photos and can share them with Instagram contacts, as well as friends on other social networks like Twitter and Facebook. The Instagram API provides access to user authentication, friend connections, photos and all the other elements of the iPhone app--including uploading new media.

related_apis.title: Pinboard API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Pinboard is a social bookmarking tool with an API patterned off of Yahoo's popular Delicious service. Create, tag and search bookmarks. Write applications based off aggregated knowledge of public bookmarks, or a particular user's public bookmarks. The API uses RESTful protocol and responses are formatted in XML and JSON.

related_apis.title: Instapaper API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Instapaper API allows third-party applications to add URLs to Instapaper. Instapaper is a service that lets users save long web pages to read at a later time. The API has a single method. It uses RESTful calls and responses are formatted in JSON.

related_apis.title: Zootool API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Zootool is a webservice that lets users collect, organize, and share their favorite images, videos, and documents from all over the web. The Zootool API lets developers build their own applications around Zootool's tools. Developers can access user information, such as friends, followers and items. In addition, the API provides access to detailed item data, including the number of views and likes. Applications can also add new items to the Zootool database.

related_apis.title: Readability API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Readability is a subscription service that lets users bookmark articles/webpages and read them later in a comfortable reading view. Readability also supports the writers and publishers of content/articles by paying them part of a users subscription fee when a user bookmarks their content. The Readability API allows users to interact with articles in their reading list as well as article contributions. Users can easily add bookmarks to their reading list as well as pull the content for an article in their reading list.

related_apis.title: Gravatar API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Gravatar is a web service that lets users create profiles and avatars called Gravatars. A Gravatar is an image that follows you from site to site appearing beside your name when you do things like comment or post on a blog. Gravatar has several developer services that do not require application authentication (although to edit user information in XML-RPC a user must be authenticated).

related_apis.title: Scoop.it API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Scoop.it is a social media and content curation platform. It associates a piece of web content with a curator on a topic together with essential meta data. The Scoop.it API lets developers use this data to build web sites, clients or other applications for content distribution.
The Scoop.it API gives the programmer access to the following functionalities of the Scoop.it platform: - read the profile of a User - read some data of a Topic - read some data of a Post - read notifications - perform actions on topics and posts
It uses RESTful calls and responses are formatted in JSON.

related_apis.title: Boxcar API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Boxcar is an application that allows users to get messages and updates from all of their favorite services, including Twitter, Facebook, email accounts, RSS feeds, Google Voice, and more.
The Boxcar provider API is for websites, companies, and users that wish to offer their services to either a select group of Boxcar users, or to all Boxcar users. With this API, providers can do a variety of things to interact with Boxcar users, such as invite Boxcar users to add the service to their Boxcar account, broadcast notifications to users and providers, and offer subscription management (adding, deleting).

related_apis.title: WordPress.com API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
WordPress.com is the hosted version of the popular open source blogging software. WordPress.com exposes site, post, comment, and like data via an REST Application Programming Interface (API) in a JSON format. The OAuth2 protocol is used for authentication.
The standard WordPress XML-RPC API is also supported by WordPress.com using OAuth2 and basic auth.

related_apis.title: Buffer API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Buffer is a service that allows users to manage and schedule their tweets throughout the day. Users add tweets to their "Buffer," and Buffer schedules them to go out regularly throughout the day.
The Buffer API allows developers to access and integrate the functionality and data of Buffer with other applications and to create new applications. Some example API methods include retrieving user and profile information, creating and managing updates, and accessing the sent and pending updates.

related_apis.title: Svpply API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Svpply is a social marketplace for users who want to share items they like or have purchased on the web. Users add items they find online to their Svpply bookmarklet that transfers the items to the public Svpply shop page. The API is RESTful and responds in JSON. Access to collections of products, permalinks, users, and more of the shopâ€™s functionality is exposed through it.

related_apis.title: APIfy API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: APIfy converts data that exists in HTML tables and Wiki pages into JSON APIs. The JSON is cached to make the APIs run faster and the APIs can be called from Ruby/Python/Node.js/Mobile apps or directly from Javascript using JSONP. The API is intended for use on small datasets for which no API currently exists such as a list of favorite TV show episodes. It uses RESTful calls and responses are formatted in JSON.

title: Mashup: DocuSign Ink for Good
description: A secure and versatile mobile solution that integrates eSignature transaction management with enterprise-grade mobile security from Good Technology. This mashup allows business users to send, sign, and manage documents electronically on any device, at any time, and from any location, ensuring both efficiency and security.

related_apis.title: DocuSign Enterprise API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
DocuSign is a Cloud based legally compliant eSignature service. DocuSign service provides an intuitive web, mobile and an API interfaces. DocuSign API allows an application to connect DocuSign service or embed parts of DocuSign user experience.
By connecting to DocuSign web services applications can create electronic signature transactions, retrieve electronically signed documents, get up to date status on outstanding envelopes and do other Create/Read/Update/Delete operations.
By embedding DocuSign interface applications can provide single-sign-on capability and insert signing or sending user experience into their applications.

title: Mashup: Reptiles Now
description: A reptile and amphibian classified ad platform, offering a marketplace for the sale of reptiles, lizards, and snakes. The mashup facilitates the buying and selling of these animals through online classified advertisements, catering to both pet enthusiasts and collectors. It integrates features for posting and browsing listings, providing detailed information about available reptiles and amphibians, including species, age, health status, and seller details. The platform supports real-time communication between buyers and sellers, allowing for direct transactions facilitated by the website.

related_apis.title: Google Maps API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: [This API is no longer available. Google Maps' services have been split into multiple APIs, including the Static Maps API, Street View Image API, Directions APIs, Distance Matrix API, Elevation API, Geocoding API, Geolocation API, Places API, Roads API, and Time Zone API.This page is maintained purely for historical and research purposes.]The Google Maps API allow for the embedding of Google Maps onto web pages of outside developers, using a simple JavaScript interface or a Flash interface. It is designed to work on both mobile devices as well as traditional desktop browser applications. The API includes language localization for over 50 languages, region localization and geocoding, and has mechanisms for enterprise developers who want to utilize the Google Maps API within an intranet. The API HTTP services can be accessed over a secure (HTTPS) connection by Google Maps API Premier customers.

related_apis.title: YouTube API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
The Data API allows users to integrate their program with YouTube and allow it to perform many of the operations available on the website. It provides the capability to search for videos, retrieve standard feeds, and see related content. A program can also authenticate as a user to upload videos, modify user playlists, and more.
This integration can be used for a variety of uses such as developing a web application allowing users to upload video to YouTube, or a device or desktop application that brings the YouTube experience to a new platform. The Data API gives users programmatic access to the video and user information stored on YouTube. This can be used to personalize a web site or application with the user's existing information as well as perform actions like commenting on and rating videos. This RESTful API provides responses in XML format.

related_apis.title: Google AdSense API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
The Google AdSense API is ideal for developers whose users create their own content through blogging, web publishing, forum/wiki/community creation, or any other application where substantial web content is generated.
Using the AdSense API, developers can let users sign up for AdSense through their site or program, generate detailed performance reports for users, and choose how the AdSense revenue is shared with our revenue sharing program. Additionally users can create accounts to store publisher website information, then generate ad code snippets and filter out unwanted ads.
A previous SOAP version has been deprecated in favor of REST with responses formatted as JSON.

related_apis.title: Oodle API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: From their site: Oodle makes it easy to use online classifieds. We bring together loads of listings from hundreds of local and national sources and help you find exactly what you\'re looking for

title: Mashup: Cloud PHR Pro
description: An intuitive and robust native iPhone application for Google Health, Google's Personal Health Record (PHR). The Cloud PHR Pro app provides a seamless mobile interface for users to securely access, manage, and update their health records stored in Google Health. It leverages Google Health's API to ensure real-time synchronization of health data across devices and supports a variety of health data types including medical history, medications, allergies, and more.

title: Mashup: Top 99 Palettes at Once
description: A visually comprehensive tool that showcases the top or newly added 99 palettes simultaneously from a selected COLOURlovers user or the entire community. Each palette's colors are represented as thin vertical stripes for easy comparison and viewing.

related_apis.title: COLOURlovers API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: From their site: With the release of the COLOURlovers API, you can now access almost 1 million named colors and more than 325,000 color palettes for your creative projects and applications. Creating a theme editor and want to give your users some color theme options? Who knows what amazingly creative stuff people will come up with.

title: Mashup: DocuSign & Appirio
description: DocuSign & Appirio is a strategic partnership that combines the power of electronic signatures with comprehensive cloud services and consulting expertise. Since 2006, Appirio, a trusted cloud advisor, has been helping companies leverage cloud platforms like salesforce.com, Google, Workday, and Amazon Web Services. By providing technology-enabled services, they assist customers in adopting, connecting, extending, and managing their cloud systems. This mashup offers a unique blend of capabilities, enabling businesses to not only secure documents with electronic signatures but also to effectively integrate and utilize cloud solutions for enhanced operational efficiency and innovation.

related_apis.title: DocuSign Enterprise API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
DocuSign is a Cloud based legally compliant eSignature service. DocuSign service provides an intuitive web, mobile and an API interfaces. DocuSign API allows an application to connect DocuSign service or embed parts of DocuSign user experience.
By connecting to DocuSign web services applications can create electronic signature transactions, retrieve electronically signed documents, get up to date status on outstanding envelopes and do other Create/Read/Update/Delete operations.
By embedding DocuSign interface applications can provide single-sign-on capability and insert signing or sending user experience into their applications.

title: Mashup: FitDataSync
description: FitDataSync is a free application that enables automatic syncing of fitness activities from Garmin devices to Fitbit accounts, eliminating the need for users to carry their Fitbit tracker at all times. The app ensures seamless integration of Garmin data into the Fitbit dashboard, providing users with a comprehensive view of their physical activity. Additionally, FitDataSync facilitates the synchronization of Fitbit Aria Wi-Fi Smart Scale weight measurements with Garmin Connect, thereby offering a unified platform for tracking and managing fitness data across both devices.

related_apis.title: Fitbit API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Fitbit helps people lead healthier, more active lives by empowering them with data, inspiration and guidance to reach their goals. As the leader in the connected health and fitness category, Fitbit designs products and experiences that track everyday health and fitness. The Fitbit Web API enables third-party applications to access and write data on behalf of users.

related_apis.title: Garmin Communicator Plugin API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Garmin Communicator Plugin API provides developers with the ability to integrate the communicator plugin to any website. It is a software program that transfers data between websites and Garmin GPS Devices. This API has many features, some of which include auto detection of devices, product information access, reading fitness data from supported devices, geo-code address and saving it to a device, and more...

title: Mashup: Flickr Video Browser
description: This mashup leverages the Flickr API's video capabilities to offer a dynamic browsing experience for the latest video uploads on Flickr. Users can explore and interact with video content, view metadata, and potentially engage with other video-related features integrated through the API.

related_apis.title: Flickr API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Flickr API can be used to retrieve photos from the Flickr photo sharing service using a variety of feeds - public photos and videos, favorites, friends, group pools, discussions, and more. The API can also be used to upload photos and video.The Flickr API supports many protocols including REST, SOAP, XML-RPC. Responses can be formatted in XML, XML-RPC, JSON and PHP. Documentation is included for 14 API Kit libraries.

title: Mashup: Noterize and Box.net
description: Noterize is an iPad application that facilitates the viewing and annotation of PDF documents and PowerPoint presentations. Through its integration with Box.net, users can seamlessly save their annotated documents directly into their Box account, providing a convenient way to manage and share their notes and documents across various devices and platforms.

related_apis.title: Box API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Box is a modern content management platform that transforms how organizations work and collaborate to achieve results faster.Box Platform provides content APIs to build secure content experiences in custom apps. With Box Platform, organizations can bring content management and collaboration services to their own custom apps or build custom integrations with Box.

title: Mashup: Video Evolved
description: A mashup that combines YouTube's video content with playlist generation capabilities. It allows users to create and embed back-to-back video playlists on their blogs based on specific search terms, providing a seamless and engaging video experience for readers.

related_apis.title: YouTube API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
The Data API allows users to integrate their program with YouTube and allow it to perform many of the operations available on the website. It provides the capability to search for videos, retrieve standard feeds, and see related content. A program can also authenticate as a user to upload videos, modify user playlists, and more.
This integration can be used for a variety of uses such as developing a web application allowing users to upload video to YouTube, or a device or desktop application that brings the YouTube experience to a new platform. The Data API gives users programmatic access to the video and user information stored on YouTube. This can be used to personalize a web site or application with the user's existing information as well as perform actions like commenting on and rating videos. This RESTful API provides responses in XML format.

title: Mashup: Diabetes Prevalence & Clinical Research in the United States
description: An interactive web application that provides a detailed overview of diabetes prevalence across the United States, integrating data on prevalence rates, percentage of population affected, and incidence density per square mile. Additionally, the application includes a layer that displays recruiting diabetes clinical trials throughout the U.S., facilitating access to clinical research opportunities. This mashup combines health data visualization with interactive mapping to offer a comprehensive view of diabetes prevalence and clinical research sites.

related_apis.title: Eli Lilly Clinical Open Innovation API MASTER RECORD

versions.version_title: Eli Lilly Clinical Open Innovation REST API

title: Mashup: Turismo Peru
description: A comprehensive travel and tourism guide to Peru, combining the services of local travel agencies with maps, city guides, tour options, historical insights, adventure activities, natural destinations, Peruvian cuisine, and a rich collection of pictures and videos showcasing the country's diverse offerings.

related_apis.title: Google Maps API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: [This API is no longer available. Google Maps' services have been split into multiple APIs, including the Static Maps API, Street View Image API, Directions APIs, Distance Matrix API, Elevation API, Geocoding API, Geolocation API, Places API, Roads API, and Time Zone API.This page is maintained purely for historical and research purposes.]The Google Maps API allow for the embedding of Google Maps onto web pages of outside developers, using a simple JavaScript interface or a Flash interface. The API HTTP services can be accessed over a secure (HTTPS) connection by Google Maps API Premier customers.

title: Mashup: Geo IP Tool
description: An online tool that provides geographical information for any IP address or domain worldwide. By integrating with IP geolocation APIs, it offers real-time location data for Internet users, enabling applications in network security, user profiling, and global marketing.

related_apis.title: Google Maps API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: [This API is no longer available. Google Maps' services have been split into multiple APIs, including the Static Maps API, Street View Image API, Directions APIs, Distance Matrix API, Elevation API, Geocoding API, Geolocation API, Places API, Roads API, and Time Zone API.This page is maintained purely for historical and research purposes.]The Google Maps API allow for the embedding of Google Maps onto web pages of outside developers, using a simple JavaScript interface or a Flash interface. The API HTTP services can be accessed over a secure (HTTPS) connection by Google Maps API Premier customers.

title: Mashup: googlUpon
description: A Google search enhancement that provides users with the ability to save any interesting search results into a temporary folder. This folder can then be used to refine search terms and re-run searches, effectively expanding the discovery process and targeting more specific information. The mashup leverages semantic search capabilities to improve the relevance of results, allowing users to efficiently refine their queries based on saved content, thus enhancing the discovery of new topics or clarifying intended search objectives.

title: Mashup: CouponFollow
description: CouponFollow is a real-time social commerce mashup that tracks and organizes coupon codes shared by Twitter users, allowing bargain shoppers to quickly find and use these codes. The mashup utilizes Twitter's API to monitor and analyze the popularity of coupons based on the number of times they are retweeted. Members can easily share and retweet their favorite coupon codes via Twitter, making it a convenient tool for both merchants looking to increase coupon distribution and consumers seeking the best deals.

related_apis.title: Twitter API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: [This API is no longer available. title: Mashup: Open City Agora
description: A comprehensive platform for creating and sharing interactive maps that integrate various layers of geolocated data, including open data and Google Places. Users can curate their own views by combining different data sources, providing a unique perspective on local information and enhancing the Places search experience. Open City Agora aims to centralize the vast amount of geolocated data scattered across multiple sources, presenting it in a single, user-friendly view. By participating in the Google Places API Developer Challenge 2012, the platform showcases its innovative approach to combining different data types to enrich the local search and mapping experience.

related_apis.title: Google Maps API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: [This API is no longer available. Google Maps' services have been split into multiple APIs, including the Static Maps API, Street View Image API, Directions APIs, Distance Matrix API, Elevation API, Geocoding API, Geolocation API, Places API, Roads API, and Time Zone API.This page is maintained purely for historical and research purposes.]The Google Maps API allow for the embedding of Google Maps onto web pages of outside developers, using a simple JavaScript interface or a Flash interface. It is designed to work on both mobile devices as well as traditional desktop browser applications. The API includes language localization for over 50 languages, region localization and geocoding, and has mechanisms for enterprise developers who want to utilize the Google Maps API within an intranet. The API HTTP services can be accessed over a secure (HTTPS) connection by Google Maps API Premier customers.

related_apis.title: Google App Engine API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
[This API is no longer available. Its functions have been split among the following APIs: Google App Engine Admin, Google App Engine Task Queue, Google Cloud App Engine Tasks, Google App Engine Admin RPC. This profile is being maintained purely for historical and research purposes.]
Use the Google App Engine platform to run web apps on Google's infrastructure, the same scalable systems that run Google applications. Use the platform to run your apps reliably, even if you have heavy load and data needs. The environment has dynamic web serving, persistent storage with queries, sorting and transactions, automatic scaling and load balancing, APIs for authenticating users and sending email using Google Accounts, and a local testing environment.

related_apis.title: San Francisco Crimespotting API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
The service operates independently of the city of San Francisco, Calif., and San Francisco Police Department, but it repackages data from the city's own crime-mapping program, CrimeWatch. It emphasizes location-aware mapping of crime reports by date, type of offense, police precinct, and related details. Its goal is to aid in discovery of crime activity within the areas of specific homes, schools, and workplaces.
API methods allow retrieval of crime reports for specified crime types, police beats, and date ranges. Methods return reports with location information -- street address as well as latitude and longitude -- to aid in mapping.

related_apis.title: Google Fusion Tables API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Google Fusion Tables is a free service for sharing and visualizing data online. It lets you upload data, share and mark up your data with collaborators, merge data from multiple tables, and create visualizations such as charts and maps. The API lets you update and query your dataset in Fusion Tables programmatically. The API lets you import data from other data sources, whether a text file or a full database.

related_apis.title: Google Maps Places API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
The Google Maps Places API is a service that returns information about a "place": an establishment, a geographic location, or prominent point of interest using an HTTP request. Place requests specify locations as latitude/longitude coordinates.
Methods are available for place search, details, photos, and autocomplete queries. The Places API returns mapping data in JSON and XML formats, after making URI requests, and authenticating with API Key.

related_apis.title: NYC Open Data API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: NYC Open Data is a collection of 750 New York City public datasets made available by city agencies and organizations. Some of the popular data includes parking facilities, federal stimulus expenditures and electric consumption by zip code. Also included are Open 311 service requests, health and education data.

versions.version_title: NYC Open Data Unspecified API v1.0

title: Mashup: ChapterBoard
description: ChapterBoard is a comprehensive web application designed specifically for fraternities and sororities. It serves as a centralized platform where each chapter can access a private space to manage and coordinate their activities effectively. Key features include messaging capabilities for seamless communication, social functionalities to foster community engagement, mobile accessibility to ensure on-the-go management, and robust event coordination tools to plan and execute gatherings efficiently. Additionally, the platform includes a dues collection system to streamline financial contributions from members. Overall, ChapterBoard provides a tailored solution for fraternity and sorority organizations to enhance their operations and member experiences.

related_apis.title: Twilio API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Twilio provides a simple hosted API and markup language for businesses to quickly build scalable, reliable and advanced voice and SMS communications applications. Twilio provides a telephony infrastructure web service "in the cloud", enabling web programmers to integrate real-time phone calls into their applications. Twilio's simple Pay-As-You-Go pricing model means customers pay for capacity only when they need it, not before. Voice applications written on Twilio's cloud solution scale transparently, eliminating programming, operational and contractual headaches frequently associated with rapid growth or traffic spikes.
Twilio provides a cloud API for voice and SMS communications that leverages existing web development skills, resources and infrastructure. It minimizes the learning curve required to build advanced, reliable voice communications applications that solve critical business needs. The syntax and programming model are focused on making application development as close to the request/response model of web application development as possible. The API uses a RESTful interface and responses are formatted in HTML, JSON, XML or CSV.

related_apis.title: Twilio SMS API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Twilio SMS API allows developers to send and receive SMS messages, track sent messages, and retrieve and modify message history from their applications. This API uses a RESTful interface over HTTPS.Twilio is a cloud communications platform that provides tools for adding messaging, voice, and video to web and mobile applications.

title: Mashup: VCarious
description: An interactive, community-driven travel platform that integrates user-generated content, social features, and mapping technologies to provide comprehensive travel guides, journaling capabilities, photo sharing, and more. Users can explore the world through dynamic, user-curated travel guides, create and share travel journals, upload photos, and engage with other travelers using various social features such as comments, likes, and user profiles. It combines social networking with travel planning and sharing, offering a unique, community-focused travel experience.

title: Mashup: YouTube Car Videos
description: A video-based mashup that integrates automotive YouTube content with used car search functionality, allowing users to search and view car videos by make and model, and integrate with a used car search tool featuring a new photo lot feature.

related_apis.title: YouTube API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
The Data API allows users to integrate their program with YouTube and allow it to perform many of the operations available on the website. It provides the capability to search for videos, retrieve standard feeds, and see related content. A program can also authenticate as a user to upload videos, modify user playlists, and more.
This integration can be used for a variety of uses such as developing a web application allowing users to upload video to YouTube, or a device or desktop application that brings the YouTube experience to a new platform. The Data API gives users programmatic access to the video and user information stored on YouTube. This can be used to personalize a web site or application with the user's existing information as well as perform actions like commenting on and rating videos. This RESTful API provides responses in XML format.

title: Mashup: NYC Wine Shops
description: An interactive map of wine shops in New York City that offers brief summaries and direct links to the websites of each shop. Users can explore local wine retailers, read about their offerings, and easily access their online presence.

description: This mashup is a platform that aggregates French real estate listings, roommate opportunities, and job postings into a single, user-friendly interface. It allows users to search for and compare properties for sale or rent, find roommates for sharing accommodation, and explore job opportunities across various sectors in France. The mashup utilizes data from multiple sources, including real estate agencies, employment websites, and social platforms, to provide comprehensive and up-to-date information to its users.

description: A curated news aggregator that provides the latest updates on Web 2.0 technologies and trends from multiple reputable sources. This mashup leverages the Yahoo Pipes platform to filter, organize, and present the most relevant and timely Web 2.0 news stories in a single, easy-to-access location. It is designed for developers, enthusiasts, and professionals seeking to stay informed about the dynamic Web 2.0 landscape.

title: Mashup: Flitpay
description: A cryptocurrency exchange platform focused on converting Bitcoin to Indian Rupees (INR) with competitive rates and minimal transaction fees. Users can buy and sell Bitcoin in India through a secure, fast, and efficient system, ensuring the best possible rates for transactions.

related_apis.title: Blockchain Wallet API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Blockchain Wallet API allows Merchants to use a simple interface can to interact with electronic wallets. This API decrypt the wallet as needed and re-saves. This API uses HTTP GET and POST requests. The API allows single or multiple payments to be made individually, wallet balances, and address management functions. API Key is required for authentication

title: Mashup: People Magazine Headlines Mobile
description: A mobile application that offers the latest entertainment news, gossip, and rumors from People Magazine via SMS, WAP, and Email. Users can access this service instantly by sending the keyword 'people' to receive timely updates on celebrity news and trends. This mashup integrates People Magazine's content with various mobile messaging platforms to deliver current events directly to users' devices.

title: Mashup: One Stop Cottage
description: One Stop Cottage is a specialized holiday rental search engine designed to help users find their ideal UK holiday cottage quickly and efficiently. By leveraging an extensive database of over 40,000 cottages from 35 leading holiday rental companies, the mashup provides a seamless and fast search experience. Users can filter results based on location, amenities, price, and availability, ensuring that they find the perfect accommodation for their needs. The dynamic search capabilities ensure that users always have access to the latest and most accurate information regarding availability and pricing, enhancing the user experience and making the search process more efficient.

title: Mashup: foursquare for webos
description: A location-based social networking mashup that integrates with the webOS platform to enable users to check-in at various locations, including cafes, bars, restaurants, parks, homes, and offices. The mashup provides real-time updates to friends about the user's location and offers personalized recommendations for places to visit and activities to engage in based on the user's location. It leverages social networking APIs to share information about the user's whereabouts and to provide a network of friends' check-in data. The mashup enhances the user experience by connecting them with friends and providing insights into the places their friends frequent.

related_apis.title: Foursquare API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Foursquare Places API provides location based experiences with diverse information about venues, users, photos, and check-ins. The API supports real time access to places, Snap-to-Place that assigns users to specific locations, and Geo-tag. Additionally, Foursquare allows developers to build audience segments for analysis and measurement. JSON is the preferred response format.

title: Mashup: Webcam Looker
description: A real-time video surveillance system designed to allow users to remotely monitor and broadcast images of their homes or offices via the internet or mobile devices. This mashup integrates video streaming technologies with internet connectivity to provide secure, live video feeds to authorized users, ensuring enhanced home and office security from anywhere with an internet connection.

related_apis.title: Clickatell HTTP API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Clickatell HTTP API offers simple, versatile internet connectivity to the Clickatell service and is one of seven SMS APIs offered. It allows you to send SMS messages around the world to your clients, staff or user-database. All the APIs support text, Unicode, binary SMS and flash messaging. This can be used either in the form of an HTTP POST or GET and includes Text, Flash, Unicode and 8-bit SMS messaging. Clickatell covers over 819 networks in more than 220 countries. Connecting you to the wireless world through simple integration while offering complete customization and personalization allowing the client to define the Sender ID and message content.

title: Mashup: Will It Freeze Tonight?
description: A weather-based mashup that provides a real-time alert system to determine if temperatures will fall below freezing in a user's current location. Utilizing HTML5 and geolocation technology, the mashup is designed for seamless use on both mobile devices and desktop browsers, offering quick access to localized weather data. It integrates with weather APIs to deliver accurate temperature forecasts tailored to the user's specific geographic area, enhancing the accuracy of the freeze warning.

related_apis.title: GeoNames API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Geonames is a geographical database with web services that let users extract useful information about different places, such as weather, timezone and post codes. The GeoNames geographical database covers all countries and contains over eight million placenames that are available for download free of charge. Users can edit, correct and add new names using a wiki interface.Geonames provides a suite of Webservices including the following categories:Fulltext searchPlace HierarchyWikipediaPostal CodesReverse GeocodingThe APIs use RESTful protocol and responses vary in format between XML, JSON, CSV, and TXTWhile the GeoNames data is free, the data is available without costs, there is a Service Level Agreement available for premium web services.

title: Mashup: My Del.icio.us Recommendation Snippet
description: A recommendation link list generator that extracts site owners' bookmarks archived in del.icio.us. By entering your del.icio.us ID, users can generate a list of recommendations based on the bookmarks of the site owner, facilitating social bookmarking and providing a visual representation of the bookmark data.

related_apis.title: del.icio.us API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
From their site: del.icio.us is a social bookmarking website -- the primary use of del.icio.us is to store your bookmarks online, which allows you to access the same bookmarks from any computer and add bookmarks from anywhere, too. On del.icio.us, you can use tags to organize and remember your bookmarks, which is a much more flexible system than folders.
The API provides read/write access to Delicious bookmarks and tags via an HTTP-based interface. The RESTful API returns responses in XML.

title: Mashup: Gatekrash Mobile
description: A touchscreen-optimized mobile application that provides event listings for the UK. It utilizes the Gatekrash API to fetch and display relevant event data, enhancing the user experience by being tailored for mobile devices and optimizing search and reference capabilities. The application focuses on English events and integrates social features for enhanced interaction.

related_apis.title: Gatekrash API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Gatekrash aggregates event listings in the UK by searching other websites. Gatekrash then collects the listings and provides filter and sort options. Events are grouped geographically, by venue or by other similarity.
The Gatekrash API provides a RESTful interface to the Gatekrash event database. The API is currently free to use, with no rate limiting or authentication required, though considered to be in "perpetual beta."

title: Mashup: Montreal Transit Planner
description: A comprehensive public transit planning tool for Montreal that integrates real-time transit data with user preferences and dynamic stop photos from Flickr. Users can specify their origin, destination, and trip options, including preferred modes of transportation and accessibility needs. The mashup leverages transit APIs, geolocation services, and photo retrieval from Flickr to provide a personalized, visually rich, and accurate transit planning experience for Montreal residents and visitors.

related_apis.title: Flickr API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Flickr API can be used to retrieve photos from the Flickr photo sharing service using a variety of feeds - public photos and videos, favorites, friends, group pools, discussions, and more. The API can also be used to upload photos and video.The Flickr API supports many protocols including REST, SOAP, XML-RPC. Responses can be formatted in XML, XML-RPC, JSON and PHP. Documentation is included for 14 API Kit libraries.

description: A visual platform that aggregates and displays the most popular art and design events in Tokyo through interactive bubbles. The mashup utilizes the ArtBeat API to provide real-time updates on event schedules, locations, and popularity, allowing users to explore the vibrant art scene in Tokyo.

related_apis.title: ArtBeat API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Use the ArtBeat API to get art and design event information for different areas of NYC or Tokyo. Get events by longitude and latitude, area, media, popularity...

title: Mashup: Care2
description: Care2 is an online community platform designed to facilitate positive social and environmental change. The mashup connects individuals and businesses with nonprofit organizations and eco-friendly businesses, enabling them to engage in and support causes that align with their values. It provides a space for users to participate in and promote initiatives that make a difference, fostering a collective effort towards creating a better world. Care2 integrates community-building features, cause-awareness campaigns, and sustainable business practices to empower users to contribute to social and environmental improvements.

related_apis.title: NationBuilder API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: NationBuilder is an open platform for users to create online communities centered around issues relevant to them. Users can create community organization websites, access a people database, and use communication tools such as email, text messaging and social media.The NationBuilder API helps developers to create community organizing-driven applications by integrating various service endpoints within third-party applications. These endpoints can be information on people, campaign data, donation data, calendar information, event data, and other calls. The API uses REST calls and returns JSON.

title: Mashup: LazyTweet
description: LazyTweet is a question and answer service that leverages and enhances the existing questions on Twitter. By expanding the reach of questions beyond a user's immediate followers, LazyTweet increases the likelihood of receiving answers from a broader audience. This mashup integrates Twitter's social platform with the Q&A functionality to provide a more efficient question-answering experience.

related_apis.description: [This API is no longer available. The Twitter REST API methods allow developers to access core Twitter data. This includes update timelines, status data, and user information. The Search API methods give developers methods to interact with Twitter Search and trends data. The API presently supports the following data formats: XML, JSON, and the RSS and Atom syndication formats, with some methods only accepting a subset of these formats.

description: An Australian postal tracking service that leverages Australia Post's parcel tracking API to provide real-time location data for parcels. The mashup integrates this data with Google Maps to visually display the current or predicted location of the parcel on an interactive map. This service offers a convenient way for users to monitor the delivery status of their packages in real-time, enhancing the user experience by combining postal services with mapping technology.

description: So Audible is a cloud-based music player that allows users to synchronize their music tracks, share them with friends, and upload them for quick sharing. It supports HTML5 playback, is compatible with iPad, iPhone, and Android devices, and enables users to play music anywhere. The service is particularly suited for long mixes, meetings, sermons, podcasts, and radio content.

related_apis.title: Amazon S3 API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Since 2006 Amazon Web Services has been offering web services commonly known as cloud computing. AWS Provides a reliable, low cost infrastructure platform that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses.
Amazon S3 API, the Simple Storage Service provides a simple web services interface used to store objects using the Amazon online storage infrastructure. Users can then download the data or use the data with other AWS services, such as Amazon Elastic Cloud Computer (EC2). Using this web service, developers can build applications that make use of Internet storage.
The API uses Buckets, Objects, Keys and Operations. An object has four parts: value, key, metadata, and an access control policy. Objects are stored in buckets. The API is REST based. Responses are formatted in JSON.

related_apis.title: Amazon SES API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Amazon Simple Email Service, or SES, provides cloud-based email as a service. Amazon SES simplifies sending emails from applications being hosted on services such as Amazon EC2. Because email services are often used by spammers, Amazon SES provides each user with a quota. EC2 users can send 2,000 emails per day for free.
The service allows developers to send either raw email or formatted email using Amazon's SMTP servers. Any spam complaints or other issues bubble back up to the developer. Similar to other Amazon Web Services, Amazon SES charges per gigabyte for transfer in and out of its systems.

title: Mashup: 100 Destinations
description: An immersive travel experience platform that aggregates and curates photos, quotes, and insights from social media platforms like Twitter. Users can explore destinations through the eyes of locals, gaining a deeper understanding of the culture and atmosphere of various cities. The mashup seamlessly integrates social media APIs to access real-time content and provides a humorous, engaging travel guide.

description: A music-focused mashup that integrates popular music databases, YouTube video services, and geolocation mapping to provide a comprehensive music experience. Users can search for their favorite artists, view upcoming concerts and events with ease, and watch the latest music videos directly within the mashup, offering a seamless journey from discovery to entertainment.

related_apis.description: Eventful is the world's largest collection of events, taking place in local markets throughout the world, from concerts and sports to singles events and political rallies. Eventful.com is built upon a unique, open platform that enables partners and web applications to leverage Eventful's data, features and functionality via the Eventful API. The Eventful API provides access to the entire site database enabling developers to integrate it and the functionality of the Eventful platform into web applications. Common API tasks include event and venue search. The API uses RESTful calls and responses are formatted in either XML, JSON or YAML.

title: Mashup: player4you
description: A free, ad-free video player that seamlessly plays Youtube content using a crossfader to eliminate breaks between tracks. Features a live search for easy track discovery. related_apis.description: Use the Google Analytics Management API to leverage Google's extensive website analytics tools. The API uses GET requests over HTTPS and JSON for requests/returns. Some of the functions available with the API are: List Account, Property and View (Profile) information for a user; manage properties and goals; manage user permissions; and upload cost data to Google Analytics for non-Google paid campaigns. See the extensive documentation for code samples, detailed method descriptions, and more.

related_apis.title: Facebook Graph API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Graph API is a simple, consistent view of the Facebook social graph, that uniformly represents objects in the graph and may include people, photos, events, and pages etc., the connections between them, friend relationships, shared content, and more. Public information can be accessed without a developer key/application key, but is required for private data access. Facebook Developers enables you to build, grow and monetize amazing applications.

title: Mashup: TurnHere.com

Users can explore these locations through the use of Internet video films, creating a unique, visual experience that combines mapping technology with the power of user-generated media. The mashup integrates video content with geolocation data, enabling users to discover and share stories about different places in a dynamic and engaging manner.

related_apis.title: Amazon S3 API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
Since 2006 Amazon Web Services has been offering web services commonly known as cloud computing. AWS Provides a reliable, low cost infrastructure platform that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses.
Amazon S3 API, the Simple Storage Service provides a simple web services interface used to store objects using the Amazon online storage infrastructure. Users can then download the data or use the data with other AWS services, such as Amazon Elastic Cloud Computer (EC2). Using this web service, developers can build applications that make use of Internet storage.
The API uses Buckets, Objects, Keys and Operations. An object has four parts: value, key, metadata, and an access control policy. Objects are stored in buckets. The API is REST based. Responses are formatted in JSON.

title: Mashup: Memory Press
description: A user-friendly, web-based creation tool for designing and printing personalized scrapbooks, family albums, or any other physical book. The mashup integrates seamlessly with Flickr, allowing users to import and customize their photo collections. Key features include an intuitive interface for book design, support for various photo formats, and direct printing options. The 'Start Book' feature initiates the book creation process, and the 'Demo MemoryPress' link provides a video tutorial showcasing the integration of Flickr photos and the final product.

related_apis.title: Flickr API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Flickr API can be used to retrieve photos from the Flickr photo sharing service using a variety of feeds - public photos and videos, favorites, friends, group pools, discussions, and more. The API can also be used to upload photos and video.The Flickr API supports many protocols including REST, SOAP, XML-RPC. Responses can be formatted in XML, XML-RPC, JSON and PHP. description: An online mapping application that allows users to take a virtual tour of the Earth while interacting with other online users. This mashup integrates real-time location data with instant messaging capabilities, enabling users to see where their friends are located on the map and engage in instant chat sessions with them.

title: Mashup: imageloop Gadget iGoogle
description: An iGoogle widget that displays a dynamic slideshow of user-selected photos or images. This mashup integrates with various photo hosting services to fetch images and presents them in a continuous loop on the user's iGoogle dashboard. It offers a customizable interface for users to select their images and adjust the slideshow settings. The widget supports high-resolution images and provides a seamless user experience for browsing and showcasing personal or curated image collections.

related_apis.title: Google Gadgets API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: From their site: The Google Gadgets API provides a way to put third-party content onto the Google homepage. The main use of the Google Gadgets API is to create gadgets (mini-applications) that users can add to their Google personalized homepages and other Google properties. For example, you could create a photo album gadget, or a gadget that displays an interactive game. The API is designed to be simple enough so that anyone can turn his or her web page or application into a gadget.

title: Mashup: Lyrics Feast
description: A music lyrics search platform that integrates song lyrics databases with video hosting services. Users can search for lyrics of their favorite songs and watch associated music videos. The mashup combines lyrics search capabilities with video streaming APIs to provide a comprehensive music experience.

related_apis.title: YouTube API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
The Data API allows users to integrate their program with YouTube and allow it to perform many of the operations available on the website. It provides the capability to search for videos, retrieve standard feeds, and see related content. A program can also authenticate as a user to upload videos, modify user playlists, and more.
This integration can be used for a variety of uses such as developing a web application allowing users to upload video to YouTube, or a device or desktop application that brings the YouTube experience to a new platform. The Data API gives users programmatic access to the video and user information stored on YouTube. This can be used to personalize a web site or application with the user's existing information as well as perform actions like commenting on and rating videos. This RESTful API provides responses in XML format.

related_apis.title: LyricFind API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: LyricFind provides a legal music lyrics service. LyricFind has licensing from over 2,000 music publishers, including the four majors EMI Music Publishing, Universal Music Publishing Group, Warner/Chappell Music Publishing, and Sony/ATV Music Publishing, as well as a database of those lyrics available for licensing. LyricFind APIs are encompassed by services including Lyric Display for full display of lyrics, Lyric Synchronization for display of lyrics line-by-line, and Lyric Search for finding a song via a phrase of words. Interested developers can contact the provider for API access, pricing, documentation, and more information.

title: Mashup: Loooper
description: An innovative Yahoo widget that presents a dynamic, horizontal slideshow of images sourced from various platforms. The mashup allows users to showcase their local image collections, search for images using external services such as www.imagelooop.de and www.imagelooop.com, and upload local images directly into the slideshow. This widget offers a visually engaging way to present and discover images across different sources.

title: Mashup: Moves Daily Life
description: Moves Daily Life by Hyeshik Chang is a mashup that leverages the Moves API to visualize and analyze users' daily activities and travel patterns. It provides an interactive dashboard that plots users' daily habits, including commute times, exercise routines, and resting periods, derived from detailed activity data captured by the Moves app. Users can gain insights into their daily life patterns and make informed decisions about time management and health. This mashup is particularly useful for individuals interested in personal activity tracking, health monitoring, and lifestyle optimization.

title: Mashup: Tamtami
description: A comprehensive platform for software and goods reviews, integrating bookmarking functionalities and a powerful search engine to help users find, save, and compare products across various categories. The mashup allows users to create and manage bookmarks for their favorite items, facilitating easy retrieval and comparison. It supports multiple content types, including software, goods, videos, and photos, providing a rich and diverse review experience.

title: Mashup: Facebook Bday Wish Application and QR Code Generator
description: This mashup application integrates Facebook's friend list and birthday information with a QR code generator to facilitate personalized birthday wishes. Users can access this application through popular browsers like Firefox and Chrome, but it may encounter issues with Internet Explorer. The application allows users to find their friends' birthdays and generate a unique QR code that the recipient can scan using a mobile device, thereby delivering a personalized birthday message or gift.

related_apis.title: Facebook Graph API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: The Graph API is a simple, consistent view of the Facebook social graph, that uniformly represents objects in the graph and may include people, photos, events, and pages etc., the connections between them, friend relationships, shared content, and more. Public information can be accessed without a developer key/application key, but is required for private data access. Facebook Developers enables you to build, grow and monetize amazing applications.

title: Mashup: Nicksmap
description: A user-friendly interactive map that displays apartment listings from Craigslist in the New York area, allowing users to easily browse and filter available properties based on location and other criteria. The mashup integrates real estate data from Craigslist with Google Maps to provide a comprehensive and visually engaging way to explore apartment listings.

[This API is no longer available. Its functions have been split among the following APIs: Google App Engine Admin, Google App Engine Task Queue, Google Cloud App Engine Tasks, Google App Engine Admin RPC. This profile is being maintained purely for historical and research purposes.]
Use the Google App Engine platform to run web apps on Google's infrastructure, the same scalable systems that run Google applications. Use the platform to run your apps reliably, even if you have heavy load and data needs. The environment has dynamic web serving, persistent storage with queries, sorting and transactions, automatic scaling and load balancing, APIs for authenticating users and sending email using Google Accounts, and a local testing environment.

title: Mashup: Safiri.dk Travel Search
description: A Danish language travel search engine that aggregates last-minute travel deals and provides comprehensive destination information. Users can search for flights, hotels, and other travel options, and the mashup offers details on weather, photos, and maps for each destination, making it a one-stop solution for Nordic travelers planning their trips.

related_apis.title: GeoNames API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Geonames is a geographical database with web services that let users extract useful information about different places, such as weather, timezone and post codes. The GeoNames geographical database covers all countries and contains over eight million placenames that are available for download free of charge. Users can edit, correct and add new names using a wiki interface.Geonames provides a suite of Webservices including the following categories:Fulltext searchPlace HierarchyWikipediaPostal CodesReverse GeocodingThe APIs use RESTful protocol and responses vary in format between XML, JSON, CSV, and TXTWhile the GeoNames data is free, the data is available without costs, there is a Service Level Agreement available for premium web services.

related_apis.title: Panoramio API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
(Deprecated in November, 2016) Using Panoramio API users can display the photos from Panoramio on their own web site. Geolocated photos from Panoramio can enrich maps or illustrate information where location is a important factor (real estate sites, hotels and vacation sites, routes & trails).
Panoramio is a website that enables digital photographers to geolocate, store and organize their photographsï¿½and to view those photographs in Google Earth and Google Maps. Panoramio is a community-powered site for exploring places through photography: cities, natural wonders, or anywhere you might go. Panoramio is different from other photo sharing sites because the photos illustrate places. As you browse Panoramio, notice that there aren't many photos of friends and family posing in front of places, or photos of interesting surfaces--Panoramio's all about seeing the world.
The Panoramio API uses a RESTful interface and responses are formatted in JSON.

related_apis.title: Wikipedia API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description:
The unofficial Wikipedia API. Because Wikipedia is built using MediaWiki, which in turn supports an API, Wikipedia does as well. This provides developers code-level access to the entire Wikipedia reference. The goal of this API is to provide direct, high-level access to the data contained in the MediaWiki databases. Client programs can use the API to login, get data, and post changes. The API supports thin web-based JavaScript clients, such as Navigation popups or LiveRC, end-user applications (such as vandal fighter), and can be accessed by another web site (tool server's utilities).
The API uses RESTful calls and supports a wide variety of formats including XML, JSON, PHP, YAML and others.

title: Mashup: Where Can I Live?
description: A travel-focused property search and comparison service that utilizes travel time analysis between stations (limited to Underground and DLR) and average house prices to help users find suitable places to live. The mashup includes a feature to view property listings around chosen stations and offers additional insights such as house price statistics. It integrates travel and real estate data to provide a comprehensive view of residential options based on commuting times and costs.

related_apis.title: OpenStreetMap API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: OpenStreetMap is the free wiki world map, an open volunteer-driven initiative to collaboratively create a map of the world, and release the map data under a free and open license.There are actually many different APIs in and around the OpenStreetMap ecosystem. Many developers searching for an API, may actually be looking for an JavaScript web mapping library. There are a few of these to choose from including free and open source options such as LeafletJS. These work by fetching map "tiles" from a tile server, and there are several of these to choose from too (the main OpenStreetMap server is not the only option)Some developers may be looking for data downloads. You can download the entire planet's worth of map data from planet.openstreetmap.org, and keep in syc with community map updates, using the "diff" downloads. Or you can download smaller more manageable country-sized, or city-size "extracts" of OpenStreetMap data.We do have a thing called the "OpenStreetMap API". This provides read and write operations on the raw map data of the OpenStreetMap database. It is actually primarily for OpenStreetMap editing software, and although any developers can create a new editor tool, this is not a small undertaking, and should be carried out with careful consultation with the OpenStreetMap community. In other words... this thing called the "OpenStreetMap API" is probably not what you're looking for!You can use the OpenStreetMap API to download small chunks of map data, but for this purpose it's also worth checking out some other options. In particular the OverpassAPI offers some flexible querying by tags etc, which may be useful for your app.Whether you're wrangling raw geo-data or presenting a web-map mashup, the possibilities provided by OpenStreetMap, and by third parties within the OpenStreetMap ecosystem, offer endless potential for geo map hacking fun! If you need help with development, join the osm-dev mailing list, or other OpenStreetMap contact channels

related_apis.title: Nestoria API MASTER RECORD
related_apis.description: Nestoria is a vertical search engine for property in the UK and Spain. The site offers an API to their database of geocoded properties.

title: Mashup: Andrew Speaker Trip Across Atlantic
description: A visual representation of the travel route of TB patient Andrew Speaker using Google Maps, integrating news service data to provide historical context and real-time information about his journey across the Atlantic. The mashup combines geospatial mapping with news feeds to offer a dynamic and informative view of the patient's movement and the associated news coverage.
